When he harvests it it’s ready to be stored in sacks like the ones shown in the photo to then go out to sell it to agencies near his place of residence that buy and sell grains.  With profits earned from his sales he’s able to cover household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife and two children who are 11 and 7 years of age and attending school at present.

Roberto is asking for a loan to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide, seeds, etc. to be able to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Manantial El Desierto Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es María Auxiliadora  mujer de 48 años de edad, casada, su negocio es de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace ocho años. De ser  cliente de la institución tiene   6 años. Con el  prestamo que cancelo  uno de sus  logros que adquirio por sus ganancias  fue  comprar productos  que  antes no tenia  en su negocio por falta de capital, estos productos  eran  cosméticos de diferentes  marcas y de casas comerciales como Avon y la  Vogue . El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, leña, jabón, Ace detergente, papel higiénico, etc. Lucia tiene 29 años y su negocio es la venta de nacatamal, Fátima tiene 23 años su negocio es  un taller de costura y Carmen tiene 43 años su negocio es la venta de comida.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 4 successful women entrepreneurs.  One of them, María Auxiliadora, is a 48-year-old married woman.  She has been operating a small grocery store from her house for 8 consecutive years and has been a member of instituation for 6 years.

With her last loan, she was able to buy products that she didn’t have before.  These included cosmetics from different brands, such as Avon, Vogue, etc.  She will invest this loan to buy grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, wood, soap, Ace detergente, toilet paper, etc.

Lucia is 29 years old and she sells Nicaraguan tamales; Fátima is 23 and owns a sewing workshop; and Carmen is 43 and she sells food.

loans.use: to buy grains such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, fire wood, soap, hace, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Celia Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Celia de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales y atol de elote desde hace varios años vende en las afueras de su casa  tiene mucha demanda especialmente los fines de semana pues cuando mas se vende sus alimentos, doña Celia esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar  elotes y azúcar por mayor para poder seguir elaborando sus alimentos y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Celia, 55, lives in her own house with her family; she’s worked making and selling tamales and corn ‘atol’ [corn-based beverage] outside her house for years.  She has much demand especially on weekends which is when her foods are sold the most. 

Celia’s asking for a loan to buy corn on the cob and sugar at wholesale to continue making her foods and earn higher profits to give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn on the cob and sugar at wholesale.

loans.name: Saul Santos

texts.es: Don saul de 49 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años su principal siembra es el maíz y el maicillo comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, don Saúl esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, veneno para plagas, etc. para seguir con su cosecha y poder darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Saul, 49, has worked in agriculture for the last 30 years; his main crops are corn and sorghum.  He sells his products to agencies that buy and sell basic grains and uses profits earned from his sales to cover his household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife and son.

Saul is asking for a loan to be able to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, etc. to continue with his crops and to be able to give his family what it needs with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don juan de 42 años de edad tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; don juan es un hombre activo, entregado a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, hará una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol,  abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. don Juan tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Juan, 42, has been working in agriculture growing corn and beans for many years.  He’s gained valuable experience that leads to his producing the best crops.  The field where he plants is located in an area of intense agricultural activity very near his home.  He sells everywhere in the community and has gained many customers that prefer him because everything he sells is top quality at affordable prices with good service.

Juan’s an active man who is dedicated to his work and who very much wants to get ahead.  He’s always looking for opportunities that will make it possible for him to attain success.  

He will make a new investment that will allow him to increase production which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy corn and bean seeds, manure, insecticide, tools, etc.  Juan has good payment references and is sure that he will be able to repay the loan while at the same time hopes to provide economic security at home.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: San Vicente Buenabaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Olga Lidia es casada, cuenta con 34 años de edad, cursó los m6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos y los 3 están estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños; inició este negocio con un préstamo failiar y hasa la fecha lleva 7 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo se su esposo quien también es comerciante.

Organiza un grupo y decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercaddería para surtir su venta tales como: calcetas, calcetines, ropa interior, pañuelos,etc. en el futuro desea tener una tienda prestigiosa donde las personas encuentres de todo, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a venta de ropa, venta de cosmétios y venta de animales.
texts.en:
Olga Lidia’s married and is 34-years-old.  She completed the six years of primary education.  She has three children and all three of them are attending school.  She works selling clothes for women, men and children.  She started the business with a family loan and to date has 7 years’ experience.  She relies on her husband’s support; he’s also a merchant.

She organized a group to request a loan to buy merchandise like socks, stockings, underwear, handkerchiefs, etc. to stock her store.  In future, she’d like to have a prestigious store where people can find everything.  The other group members sell clothes, cosmetics and animals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La Sra. Alicia tiene 48 años tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad, ella quedo viuda cuando sus hijitos eran pequeños, pero cuenta que salió adelante sola,  se dedica  a la  venta de leche y queso ya que tiene ganado vacuno, ella vive en la localidad de Higachi, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Alicia utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno y de  forraje para su ganado,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero y necesita alimentar bien a su ganado para que le proporcione buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, la Sra. Alicia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado,  sueña comprar otras vacas lecheras.
texts.en: Alicia, 48, has four adult children.  She was widowed when her children were little but she says she got ahead by herself.  She works selling milk and cheese since she owns dairy cows.  She lives in Higachi and this loan is her first sequence in the institution.  Alicia will use the loan to buy dairy cows and forage for them.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she does not have money and she needs to feed her cattle well so that it will produce good amounts of milk so she can produce more cheese and improve her income.  The business challenge Alicia faces is that forage must be purchased every so often.  She will use profits to improve her cattle; she dreams with buying more dairy cows

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Thuyen

texts.en:
Thuyen, who is 48 years old, has two children, a daughter in the seventh grade and a son who is a carpenter. Her husband is a building worker with an income of 4,500,000 VND per month. Thuyen, who has a carpentry workshop, is also a farmer, a job she has had for five years. She earns 4,000,000 VND per month from those enterprises.

Thuyen's challenge in life and work is a lack of capital to invest in her business. A participant in SEDA's credit program since 2009, in the last loan cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. A hardworking and dynamic woman, Thuyen would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more wood for her carpentry workshop. She wants to expand her business and save money for her family. Her dream is for her family to have full lives, and this loan is one step in helping her to achieve that dream.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married woman with three children. She lives in her own house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and fees for the children. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food cafe business, selling foodstuff to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil, for use during food preparation. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil, for use during food preparation.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun is a 31-year-old married woman living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is a mother of three dependent children, who have assisted her sometimes in the maintenance of the rice paddy. 

Noun and her husband help each other to manage a few plots of their farmland in order to feed their children and educate them up to at least high school level. They have been in this occupation for more than ten years, generating a net profit of KHR 5,000 each per day.

Noun would like to have her own transportation to satisfy their daily travelling needs, but she has inadequate capital to buy one. In this regard, she has requested a loan amounting to KHR 800,000 to purchase a motorbike. She hopes that, through good transportation, she can partially reduce some expenses and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Taher Group

texts.en:
This group, called Taher, consists of four members: Maisa, Entsar, Laila and Fatima, who live in Aden, Yemen. 

Maisa is 41 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide a better life for her family. She obtained more profit from the first loan and she would like to expand her business to sell different types of products. 

Therefore, she applied for a second loan of YER 60,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy gas cylinders and mobile recharge cards in order to increase her profit. 

She hopes to increase her income which, in turn, will improve her own and her child's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders and mobile recharge cards to sell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 34 years old. She has two children. They are learning at secondary school and at primary school. Her husband and she are carpenters to earn a living. He earns about 10,000,000 VND and Loan earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. Besides that, she also is a farmer. She has done this job for ten years. Her family’s total earnings are about 16,000,000 VND per month. 

Loan’s challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to invest in her business. Her dream is that her children will be successful and have a good life in the future. This loan helps her to reach this dream. 

She can invest in her carpentry workshop to gain earnings and save the profit for her children’s education. Loan is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.

Loan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She always wants to expand her business and raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Patrice

texts.fr: Patrice est un homme âgé de 40 ans, fiancé et père de famille. Il a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 1 an déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des friandises,...)et le crédit de communication, et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille
texts.en: Patrice is 40 years old, engaged and is a family man. He has owned and managed a food shop in the capital for one year. His business is successful thanks to his warm personality, his experience in the business and his loyal customers. This last point is very important and yet he cannot satisfy his customers needs because he doesn't have the capital to buy his inventory wholesale. He is requesting this loan to strengthen his working capital in order to diversify his inventory (rice, salt bottled water, sugar, candies and telephone cards). He will be able to increase his profit margins. He plans to reinvest part of this profits back into the business to cover expenses and the rest he will use to take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of essential food items.

loans.name: Ivette

texts.fr: Ivette est une femme âgé de 30 ans, fiancée mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 ans et 7 mois, deux de ses enfants vont à l'école. Elle a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 2 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'elle a acquise avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des savons,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Ivette is 30 years old, engaged and has 3 children who are between the ages of 12 years old and 7 months. Two of her children go to school. She has owned and managed a food shop in a neighborhood of the capital city for two years. Her small business is successful thanks to her warm personality, her experience in the business and her loyal customers. This last point is very important yet she struggles to satisfy her customers needs because she only has sufficient capital to buy her inventory at retail prices. She is requesting this loan to strengthen her business' capital, to be able to diversify her inventory (rice, salt, bottled water, sugar, soaps), and to be able to increase her profit margins. She plans to reinvest a portion of her profits back into the business to cover expenses and the other part she will use to take care of her and her family's daily needs.

loans.use: Augmenter son stock des produits de première nécessité

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es:
Adalberto, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita  más capital de trabajo para invertir en el cultivo de maíz y frijol; este le permitirá comprar herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, abono, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos necesarios para el cultivo y así ha logrado apoyar a su familia con la alimentación; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Adalberto requests a new loan because he needs more working capital to invest in his corn and bean crops. This will allow him to purchase herbicide, insecticide, pesticide and compost, among other items.
The previous loan helped him to buy the supplies he needed to grow the crops, and thus he was able to support his family by providing food. His financial condition and his family's situation have improved.

loans.use: to purchase herbicide, insecticide, pesticide and compost, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wholesale corn.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Doña rosa vive en casa propia con sus 4 hijos de 15, 12, 4 y 1 año de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña rosa esta solicitando un credito para comprar maiz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in her own house with her four children, ages 15, 12, 4 and 1.  She works selling tortillas from her house.  For several years she has worked from Monday to Sunday.  She has many customers because she is a very hardworking and kind person.  With the earnings that she obtains and the help of her husband they manage to cover the household expenses.  

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime to continue making tortillas and thus obtain better earnings in order to have better financial stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Sia, from the Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children.  Five years ago, Sia established her food commodities sales business. She began her business, because she wanted to improve her family's standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuations and transportation costs.

Sia requires a loan in order to purchase more food commodities to resell, including rice, cooking oil and vegetables. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. Sia plans to expand her business even more, in the future. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more food commodities to resell, including rice, cooking oil and vegetables.

loans.name: Andrew J.'s Group

texts.en:
Meet with this group of able and dedicated teachers from the eastern city of Kenema. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni (in northern Sierra Leone), to apply for a loan. They requested the amount of SLL 7,000,000, in order to meet their most immediate and pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries.

Andrew is the featured leader of this group. A native of Kailahun, the 57-year-old is married to a housewife. He is a father of 10 children, eight of whom are attending schools. Andrew has been a teacher for 30 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school and college fees for his children

loans.name: Atash

texts.en:
Atash is a kind and industrious person. He has three children, two married daughters and a 21-year-old son. Atash lives with his son and wife. He has a food selling business, selling in a food stall. He sells a variety of foodstuffs, including dumplings, flat breads, and sweets. With the support of his wife, during the past seven years he has gained much business experience in his field.

With the profits earned from the business, he made the wedding parties of his daughters, and provided each of them with a dowry. He is an intelligent and brainy man who says, "I will do all the best for my family." He is requesting a loan to purchase food ingredients to resell at his stall, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, sugar, and beans. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients to resell at his stall, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, sugar, and beans. He awaits your support.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 25 years old and single with one child, age 6. She runs a plastic business in Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She started this work because she was trained in the business. She’s been in the business for more than 11 years and sells plastic in a busy market area. She says that the main challenges for her business are price increases and the low purchasing power of customers during the dry season.

Sarah requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plastic to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her expand her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic to expand her business.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es: Doña fidelina de 60 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz, gaseosa, jugos, etc. es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que doña fidelina solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, verdura, fruta, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: Doña Fidelina is 60 years old, she lives with her husband in her own house, she is well known in the area where she lives due to her humility and dedication to work, she has never given up and has always gotten through hardships.  With hard work she made herself of a store where she sells basic products such as grains, milk, eggs, rice, pop, juice, etc.  Her work requires dedication and she is very attentive when she sells, that's why she has clients that come to her and prefer her products.  She has the need to stock her store a bit more, but doesn't have the capital to do it, that's why Fidelina requests a loan to buy more products such as basic grains, instant products, snacks, drinks, vegetables, fruits, etc.  She trusts in God that the help requested will come soon and she won't have to worry about bringing daily sustenance home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, snacks, drinks, vegetables, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is the married mother of one child attending school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a business selling clothing; she sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition. She dreams of expanding, and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000;  she wants to purchase bales of clothing to sell.  

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a married woman with children who are adults. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past 15 years, Mejumaa has operated a business of renting handcarts to people who sell water. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. With this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase more handcarts to rent to enable continuity in her expanding business.

loans.use: to purchase more handcarts to rent

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: El Sr. Efraín tiene 22 años,  se dedica al crianza de ganado y al comercio del mismo,  comercializa sus productos en la comunidad de Batallas,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Efraín va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ganado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere  tener más ganado ya que esta época es de mucha demanda, El Sr. Efraín enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el clima el tener que transportar el ganado a los distintos puntos de venta,  pero el tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo para mejorar la alimentación de  su ganado,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Efraín is 22 years old.  He makes a living raising and selling cattle.  He sells his products in the community of Batallas.  This loan is his first sequence within the institution.  Efraín is going to use this loan to purchase cattle.  His reason for requesting this loan is that he wants to have more cattle since in this period of time they are in high demand.  

Efraín faces challenges in his business which are the climate and that he has to transport the cattle to different points of sale but he has many customers because of the kindness with which he treats his clientele.  He is going to use the profits on the purchase of forage that he must buy every so often in order to improve the diet of his cattle.  

His desire for his business is to have a stable and profitable business and in this manner increase his financial income.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Jonatan Enrique

texts.es:
Jonatán, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir en la producción de pan para fortalecer este otro negocio y aumentar la clientela; este le permitirá comprar la materia prima necesaria tales como: harina, aceite, levadura, azúcar, entre otros.
El crédito anterior  le ayudo  a aumentar las utilidades del negocio de venta de medicina natural, esta las invierte en el pago de los estudios y los gastos familiares; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Jonatan needs a new loan because he needs to invest in bread production to strengthen this business and increase his client base, this loan will allow him to buy raw materials needed such as flour, oil, yeast, sugar and others.
The previous loan helped him increase profits in his business of natural medicine, he used them to pay for studies and family expenses, his economic and family condition have improved.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, yeast, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Aminata from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children. She has three additional dependent who live with her because they are relatives from the village. Aminata runs a soap business – she sells local soap and gari from her house. She has been running this business for four years. She works 8 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are lack of insufficient capital to run the business and price increases.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to purchase palm oil and soap powder to prepare the soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and expand her business. In the future, she plans to renovate her house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and soap powder to make soap.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 49-year-old Kadiatu from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 12 and 26 years old. One of her children is attending school. She started her business to improve her standard of living. Kadiatu runs a food business; she sells coal nut and nut oil. She has been running this business for seven years. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase food commodities like palm oil, nut oil and coal nut for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and pay her child's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a big food table. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food commodities like palm oil, nut oil and coal nut  for resale.

loans.name: Smaina

texts.en:
Smaina is a 27-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and one child. 

She has been running her own beauty parlor for many years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Smaina has become famous in her locality for providing the best service. 

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. Due to lack of capital, she is unable to expand her business. 

So Smaina applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is in her third loan cycle, with a good repayment history. With the help of the loan, she will purchase a variety of products which ultimately will help in generating more income for her. 

She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Jose Elizandro

texts.es: Don jose de 46 años de edad desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y maicillo, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 14, 13, 11 y 9 años de edad. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, que es su principal fuente de ingresos, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: 46-year-old Jose has been working in farming for several years. With a great deal of dedication, he grows corn and sorghum, which allows him to earn the daily bread for his household. He's known for being a hard-working, honest and responsible man. He lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife and his four children aged 14, 13, 11 and 9 years. Alongside his wife he works very hard in order to get his family ahead and provide them with better living conditions than the ones they had. Thanks to his knowledge of farming he's able to support his household. It's his main source of income, since it's the only way he knows of earning an honest living. With a lot of drive to succeed, he came to this institution in order to request a loan, because sowing season has begun and he needs to start sowing as soon as possible. That's the reason why he requests the loan, since he needs to invest in the purchase of the farming supplies he needs, such as seeds, compost, insecticide, etc., so that he can sow. He has faith in God and in his work, and trusts that this way he'll succeed in reaping a bountiful harvest which will allow him to improve both his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is married and has three children, all of whom attend school and are under her care. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. For over two years, she has operated a business selling clothes from home to her neighbours and passersby and even at the market. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business and also competition from fellow sellers. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase three bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.fr: est un homme âgé de 26 ans, fiancé et père de famille. Il a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 1 an déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des friandises,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille
texts.en: Jean Paul is a 26-year old man. He is in a relationship and has children. It has been a year since he opened his grocery store in one of the capital city’s neighborhoods. His small business is going well thanks to his friendly welcome, his experience with this line of work, and the customer base he has been able to grow. His customer numbers are increasing, and he can no longer meet demand due to his insufficient working capital and the necessity to buy retail. He is seeking this loan in order to bolster his small working capital and diversify his merchandise (rice, salt, mineral water, sugar packs, sweets etc) and to be able increase his profit margin. He will reinvest a part of his revenues in his business in order to provide for business needs and use the rest to support himself and his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of first necessity goods.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 55-year-old married woman; she has three children.  Her husband and son work for daily wages, but their income is not enough to meet all the household expenses. 

For the past four years, she has been running her own business of selling cloth. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base, and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a loan of Rs 35,000 through Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married, and has been blessed with three school going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes in the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruits to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

She dreams of expanding to a wholesale vegetable shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Juan sigue con la misma actividad del lavado de arena, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de herramientas de trabajo, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de un abomba de agua de mayor potencia para el lavado de arena, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio, mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan continues in his same activity, sand blasting. He says that it went well for him with the previous loan, because he used it to buy work tools. On this occasion, he is asking for the loan to buy a water pump with more power for the sand blasting. He feels happy and grateful for the opportunity he is being given to grow his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a water pump with more power.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Isha from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 1 5-year-old child. She began this business because she wants to stop sitting at home as a housewife and create a source of income to support her household. 

Isha runs a bowl business; she sells plastic bowls, cups, and spoons. She has been running this business for 5 years. She works at the business every day, from morning to night. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Isha has requested a loan in order to purchase plastic bowls, cups, and spoons. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls, cups, and spoons.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 37-years-old and mother of six children. She has been successfully running a small general store with the support of her husband at the corner of her house. She has two years' experience in this field.  Shamim's husband assists her by purchasing stock for the store from the market from his many contacts. 

Shamim’s general store contains lot of products for daily use. She wants to expand her business to support her large family. Shamim has applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to buy packs of salt, sugar, biscuits and beverages to meet increasing demand at her store. She is in her second loan cycle with Kashf foundation. She is hopeful that this loan will allow her to generate more income to fulfill the demands of her family members.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, sugar, biscuits and beverages to meet increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Zayda Maria

texts.es: Doña Zayda de 33 años, tiene un hijo de 16 años de edad, el no estudia labora como ayudante en un Acopio Lechero y le ayuda a su mama, ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos de cafetín, su esposo  trabaja como albañil y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, asi juntos buscan como salir adelante en familia. El crédito que necesita en la actualidad es para reparar su vivienda, la parte del techo el cual se encuentra en mal estado y le urge cambiarlo, por lo que desea comprar laminas de zinc, cuartones y clavos. Zayda no pierde la esperanza de ver su casa en buenas condiciones y brindar mejor comodidad a su familia, lo que podrá lograr poco a poco.
texts.en: Zayda is 33-years-old. She has a 16-year-old son. He does not work instead he works as an assistant to a dairy collector. He helps his mom who is a merchant. She works in the selling products at a snack stand.   Her husband works as a laborer and he helps her with the household expenses. They both work together to get their family ahead. The loan that she needs currently is to repair her home. Part of the roof is in a bad state and it is imperative to change it. For this reason she wants to buy zinc laminate, planks and nails. Zayda does not lose hope in seeing her house in a good condition and be able to provide better conditions to her family. She wants to reach this goal little by little.

loans.use: to purchase zinc laminate, planks and nails

loans.name: Elsi Noemi

texts.es:
Elsi, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para invertir en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar pollos, cerdos y concentrado para engordarlos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar los ingresos y esto las invierte en los gastos básicos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado gracias al crédito otorgado por Kiva.
texts.en:
Elsi, is in need of a new loan because she needs more capital to invest in her business. This will allow her to purchase chickens, pigs, and concentrate to fatten them. 

The previous loans helped her to increase her income and she invested it in her household expenses. The economic conditions and family circumstances have improved thanks to the loan provided by Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, pigs, and concentrate to fatten them.

loans.name: Ngone

texts.fr: Madame Ngoné est une femme qui est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle habite dans les environs du guichet et d'active dans le commerce d'habillement. Elle a une expérience de 18ans dans son activité et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h.Madame Ngoné sollicite ce prêt d'un montant de 300.000F pour acheter des chemises, des tissus, parfums et des chaussures pour les revendre à ses clients potenciels. A l'avenir Madame Ngoné souhaite augmenter ses revenus et ouvrir une grande boutique de prêt à porter. Ainsi elle  pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Ngoné is a married woman and the mother of five children.  She lives close to one of the branches of the UIMCEC and is actively involved in the sale of clothes.  She has 18 years of experience working in this field and she works from 8AM until 7PM.

Ngoné is requesting this loan of 300,000 francs to buy some shirts, fabrics, perfumes and shoes for resale to potential customers.  In the future, she would like to increase her income and to open a large store where she would sell ready-to-wear clothes.  Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shirts, fabrics, perfumes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 33-years-old. She is an energetic, married woman. She lives with her husband and four children, three of them attend school. 

Jamila's husband is a rickshaw driver but his income is not enough to meet the increasing demands of life. To contribute to the family income, Jamila has been running an animal sales business for the last eight years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. Jamila's business is provides her with a decent lifestyle and she has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses. 

To improve her business, Jamila contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to buy two goats. She expects increase her earnings and wishes to spend the part of profits on the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy two goats.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is 38-years-old. She has been running a business selling bed sheets, covers and blankets for the last 13 years. Musarat's husband is employed but has a low salary and is unable to meet their household expenses and the educational expenses of their three children. 

Musarat has a great collection to offer to her customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. In order to increase her sales, Musarat needs to purchase more bed covers, pillows and blankets in various colors and designs. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 25,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR). She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase bed covers, pillows and blankets in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo  porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de maíz, frijol, asimismo en la venta de pan; este le permitirá comprar bastante pan frances, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo aumentar los ingresos por lo que le ayudo a adquirir  los insumos agrícolas necesarios para el cultivo y pagar los estudios universitarios; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Juan is in need of a new loan because he requires more capital to continue to invest in the cultivation of corn, beans, and the sale of bread.  This will allow him to purchase enough French bread, manure, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides.

The previous loan helped him to increase his income, which helped him to purchase agricultural supplies needed for the cultivation and also helped him to pay for university studies. The economic conditions and the family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 36-year-old widow and a mother of six children. Being a single parent, she is very motivated to provide her family with good quality food, health and education. Four of her six children attend school. 

After the death of her husband, Sajida took the initiative to start her own business of selling clothes. She purchases cloth in bulk from the market at wholesale rates and then, after stitching, sells finished clothes to people in her community. She is expert in making unique and stylish designs and makes enough through her business. 

Sajida has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to purchase various colors of cloth, spools of thread, buttons and laces. With the help of this loan she will be able to increase her sales which ultimately help in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase various colors of cloth, spools of thread, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some oxen that he will raise and resell.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 49-year-old married woman who has operated a milk sales business for many years. Shahida has one buffalo in milk. She sells the milk and butter that she makes to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. 

Shahida is a mother of four children, who all attend school. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing. Shahida has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses. 

This is Shahida's fifth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business with Kashf Foundation's support. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to purchase another buffalo and feed for its calves. She hopes increase production capacity so that she can sell milk to more people in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es: Jose de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maíz y maicillo, vende sus productos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, José esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para su cosecha como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, veneno para plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía que es donde piensa hacer su siembra, para poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jose is 38 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and four children.  He works in agriculture and for several years has grown corn and sorghum.  He sells his products to bulk grain agencies located near his home.  With his earnings, he is able to cover some of his household expenses.  

Jose is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy the supplies necessary for his crops: manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, etc.  He also wants to make improvements on the land he plans to farm, shown in the photograph, and to give his family greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, etc., and make land improvements.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Doña Alicia vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, su nuera y su nieta, ella es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que doña alicia solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básico, huevos, sopas, salsas de tomate, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Alicia lives in her own home with her two children, her daughter-in-law, and her granddaughter. She is very well known in the neighborhood where she lives for her humility and her work. She has never allowed herself to fail and she has always gone forward despite difficulties. With effort and dedication she started a store where she sells products of basic need such as basic need, milk, eggs, rice, and other items. She is very dedicated to her work and is very obliging at the point of sale. For this reason she has clients that search for her and prefer her for her products. She has seen the need for her to supply her business with more items due to higher demand. However, she does not have the capital to realize this goal. 

For this reason that Alicia is requesting another loan to purchase more products such as basic grains, eggs, soups, tomato salsa, candies, drinks, etc. She trusts in God that soon the help that she is requesting is offered and this way she can have no worries that she can sustain her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, eggs, soups, tomato salsa, candies, drinks, etc

loans.name: Ana Doris

texts.es: Ana de 31 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz, vende sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtienen logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en cas apropia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ana esta solictando un crédito para poder comprar abono, herbicidas, fertilizantes, semillas, veneno para plagas, etc. para poder seguir con sus cosechas y darle  su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 31-years-old and she has worked in agriculture for many years. Her main crop is corn. She sells her products in the markets that are close to her residence. With her earnings she is able to pay the household expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband and her two children. Ana is requesting a loan to purchase manure, herbicides, fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, etc. This will help her continue with her crops and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, etc

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  huit femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées  dans les ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier de Darsalam dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce des ustensiles en plastique,  du lait de vache de toutes sortes (lait frais, caillé et du yaourt) et du savon. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 12ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nafi (1ier femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’ustensiles de toutes sortes dans le quartier de Darsalam.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter plusieurs 12ène d’ustensiles en plastique. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Nafi espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000 FCFA qui sera investi dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The eight women who make up the Danaya group are all married within monogamous households.  On average, they are 35 years old and have four children each.  They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood of the fourth administrative region of Mali and know each other through neighborhood, marriage and family ties.  They are involved in small retail business, selling plastic utensils, soap and various types of cow milk (fresh milk, curdled milk, yoghurt).

The members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses, and they are on their twelfth solidarity loan cycle.

Nafi, standing first from the left in the photo, is an important seller of various utensils in Darsalam.  She plans to use her loan to buy several dozen of plastic utensils.  She resells her merchandise for cash or on credit to a customer base which mostly consists of women.  

With this loan, Nafi hopes to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils.

loans.name: Wilmar Del Carmen

texts.es:
Wilmar, es un humilde campesino, originario de la comarca el Coyolito, en las afueras de Estelí. Ha sido un cliente beneficiado con financiamiento el cual le ha permitido comprar insumos para sacar sus siembras a tiempo y con muy buena calidad. Ahora quiere sembrar  tomate y repollo ya que está por comenzar el ciclo de siembra, esta buena la plaza de este producto porque muy pocos se dedican a esta actividad en invierno. Su expectativa es  obtener buenos rendimientos de producción. Le gustaría vender su producto a los supermercados porque le ofrecen mejor precio por el producto.
El préstamo lo solicito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas y mano de obra para cultivar media manzana de repollo. Con  este crédito podrá incrementar sus ingresos ya que comprara los insumos necesarios para garantizar la cosecha y ampliar la siembra para el próximo ciclo. Sus planes futuros son comprar dos vacas paridas para obtener otros ingresos. Sus metas próximas garantizar con el préstamo una buena cosecha para pagar el crédito y reinvertir el excedente.
texts.en:
Wilmar is a humble farmer from the Coyolito area, outside of Estelí.  He has benefitted from financing which has allowed him to buy supplies for his crops so that they could be on time and of good quality.  Now he wants to plant tomatoes and cabbage because the new crop cycle is starting.  This is a good product to produce because very few do this in the winter.  He expects to have good production results.  He would like to sell his products to supermarkets because they pay better.

He is asking for this loan to buy compost, fertilizer, pesticides, and pay for labor to raise half a hectare of cabbage.  This loan will allow him to increase his income because he will buy the supplies he needs to guarantee his harvest and expand his production for the next cycle.  His future plans are to buy two cows so he can have another source of income.  His goals are to guarantee the loan with a good harvest and reinvest the remainder.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Esperanza Emerita

texts.es: Doña esperanza vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee un molino desde hace varios años tienen mucha clientela bues es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, su esposo es agricultura siembra su propia parcela, con las ganancias que obtienen de su trabajo logran cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, doña esperanza esta solicitando un crédito para comprar cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra y poder mejorar su vivienda construyendo una pared en la entrada principal de su casa a si como muestra la fotografía,  ya que con lo que ganan no les alcanza para poder realizarlo y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: Esperanza lives in her own home with her husband and her son. She has owned a mill for several years. She has lots of clients because she is a very friendly and hardworking. Her husband is a farmer and he harvests his own plot of land. With the earnings they manage to cover the household expenses. Esperanza is requesting a loan to purchase cement, sand, bricks, iron, and to pay the workforce. This will be used to improver her home by building a wall in the main entrance of her home (as shown in the photograph). The income they earn is not sufficient to complete this objective. This way her and her family will be able to live in safer conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, iron, and to pay the workforce

loans.name: Mahliyokhon

texts.ru: Махлиёхону 31 год. Она замужняя женщина с двумя детьми, проживает в городе Исфара, на севере страны. Ее муж оказывает услуги по ремонту и строительству домов. Сама Махлиёхон с 2010 года занимается растениеводством. У нее имеется 20 соток орошаемой земли, на котором она сеит подсолнечник и кукурузу. В ведении сельского хозяйства ей также помогает муж. Сейчас Махлиёхон находится в положении и ожидает появления на свет своего третьего ребенка. Однако несмотря на свое положение Махлиёхон продолжает свою деятельность. Она запрашивает кредит для закупа семян кукурузы и подсолнечника, минеральных удобрений, а также для найма рабочих для обработки земли. Махлиёхон любит свое дело, так как позволяет ей получать хорошую выручку.
texts.en:
Mahliyokhon is 31 years old.  She is married and the mother of two children.  She lives in the city of Isfara, in northern Tajikistan.  Her husband repairs and builds houses.  Mahliyokhon herself has been involved in agriculture since 2010.  She owns 2,000 square meters (0.49 acre) of arable land on which she grows sunflowers and corn.  Her husband helps her to run her farming business.

Mahliyokhon is now pregnant and she is awaiting the birth of her third child.  However, in spite of her pregnancy, she is still involved in her activity.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn and sunflower seeds, mineral fertilizers, and to hire laborers to work on her land.

Mahliyokhon loves her work because it allows her to make a good revenue.

loans.use: to buy corn and sunflower seeds, mineral fertilizers, and to hire laborers to work on her land.

loans.name: Foad

texts.en:
Foad is a 42-year-old man from a small village near Jenin city. He is a father with two sons and two daughters. Foad has been a farmer for three years. He plants Pills and some other seasonal crops. it has been a profitable project and good enough income to provide the family's needs. 

Foad took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new tank to collect water for the crops. This loan will help him to develop his project and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy a new tank to collect water for crops.

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru: Сирочиддин женатый молодой человек в возрасте 22-х лет. Он живет с женой, двухлетним сыном и с матерью в районе Хуросон. Сирочиддин единственный кормилец семьи. Он зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь животноводством, которому он научился у своего брата. Сирочиддин на протяжении пяти лет как работает в этой области. Кроме этого он еще и земледелец с хорошим опытом. Сирочиддину в бизнесе нравится получать доход, который помогает ему продвигать быт, а также за счет деятельности он обеспечивает семью молоком и молочными продуктами. Ему в деятельности помогает брат и жена. Он в основном занимается купле-продажей крупного рогатого скота. Сирочиддин берет кредит для закупа бычков с целью их дальнейшего откорма и продажи. В ближайшем будущем Сирочиддин планирует начать бизнес в сфере птицеводства и пчеловодства и попробовать себя в этих направлениях.
texts.en:
Sirojiddin, aged 22, is a young married man.  He lives with his mother, his wife and his 2-year-old son in the Khuroson district  of Tajikistan.  He is the only breadwinner in his family and he makes a living raising livestock, an activity he learned from his brother.  Sirojiddin has now been working in animal husbandry for five years.  In addition to this, he is also an experienced farmer.

What Sirojiddin likes about his business is that it brings an income which allows him to make a living.  His activity also provides his family with milk and dairy products.  His brother and wife help him to run his business, which mostly consists of buying and selling cattle.

Sirojiddin is taking a loan to buy young bulls that he will fatten and resell.  In the near future, he is planning to explore other business opportunities and to expand into poultry farming and beekeeping.

loans.use: to buy young bulls that he will fatten and resell.

loans.name: Shamium

texts.en: Shamium is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a food stall with her husband at the corner of her house. She sells various food items such as biscuits, juices, sweets and vegetables. She has gained five years of experience in this field and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married with four school-going children. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past 20 years, selling to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during the time of cold currents in the deep sea. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking fat oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking fat oil and firewood.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 28 years old. He has sold CDs and DVDs for the past four years. With this loan, he would like to buy more CDs and DVDs to sell. He will use the profits from the business mainly to buy a home.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs for use in his music burning business.

loans.name: Fehmida

texts.en:
Fehmida, age 47, is a married woman. She has been running a business of cloth sales for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth in various colors from the main city and then sells them to the people of her city. Over time, she has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 

At this time, Fehmida requested loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different ladies’ cloth of the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy stock of different ladies’ cloth of the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is 27 years old. He lives in Marneuli district with his wife, mother, brother and sister in-law. Elshan has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Elshan has a café. He sells cold drinks and beer and earns a small monthly income. His brother is an artisan of metal-plastic doors and windows and works on private orders. 

Elshan requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Elshan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision for business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Elshan will purchase products to be able to serve food in his cafe. As he will have not only drinks but also food to offer to his clients, Elshan will attract more customers and earn a better profit. 

He will reinvest part of the profit into the same field to expand the business. Another part will be used for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase products to be able to serve food in his cafe

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete the building of her house.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana, aged 28, is a married lady. 

She has had a clothes stitching business for a period of about three years. Her husband polishes furniture and earns insufficient income to bear the household expenses alone. 

She is a mother of two children; she is a very thoughtful woman and is always thinking about a better future for her children. With the support of the Kashf Foundation, she has built a successful business. At this time, she needs to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads in various colors. 

That is why she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She dreams of providing a quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Vilayat

texts.en:
Vilayat is 31 years old and father of two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzuli refugee.  

For the past eight years, he has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. His income from this business is 140 AZN. This is a very profitable business and he is does it together with his wife.

He keeps a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from him. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

Vilayat is applying for a loan of 1800 AZN to buy 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in summer. He is optimistic about this loan, because in summer more people consume meat, due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.This is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in summer

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide all facilities of life to her family. 

For this reason, she has been running a general store for the past three years. She offers various goods for daily use at reasonable prices and has a good client list. To keep her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase stocks of rice, flour and grains, along with packs of oil and beverages. 

With the help of this loan, she will be able to meet the increasing demands of customers on time. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, flour and grains, along with packs of oil and beverages.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Sabali sont à moitié mariée et à moitié veuve toutes vivant dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 43ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent ensemble dans le quartier de Darsalam à Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leur activité, des liens de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de pomme de terre, d’échalote et des spaghettis. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 15ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Koumba (au milieu des trois femmes assises) est connue dans le quartier de Darsalam par sa qualité de restauratrice. Elle compte utiliser son prêt dans l’achat de 4 sacs de riz pour des fins de restauration chez les producteurs  de Niono. Elle vend ses plats alimentaires au comptant dans son restaurant. Madame Koumba  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments et frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women from the Sabali group are either married or widows, and all live in traditional families. They average 43 years of age with five children. They live together in the Darsalam Ségou neighborhood (4th administrative region of Mali).

They became acquainted through their activities, kinship and marriage ties. Members of the group retail potatoes, shallots and spaghetti. To increase their  supply stock, group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 15th group loan cycle.

Mrs. Koumba (in the middle of the three women sitting) is known in the Darsalam area for the quality of her restaurant. She plans to use the loan to buy four bags of rice for her restaurant from producers in Niono. She sells food dishes for cash in her restaurant.

Mrs. Koumba hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 27,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business and used to purchase household condiments and cover healthcare costs for the children.

loans.use: buy rice for her restaurant

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles Monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Darsalam dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (échalotes, choux pommés, pâtes d’arachide,…) 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nah (2ème femme debout de la  gauche vers la droite  sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 300kg d’échalote et des choux pommés. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Nah espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 47000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera investi dans l’activité et assurer le ravitaillement du foyer en condiments. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Nah a pour objectif de pérenniser leurs activités dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The six women in the Tiessiri group are married, for the most part in monogamous families. They average 33 years of age with four children. They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through neighborhood ties, kinship and marriage.

Members of the group are small retailers of condiments (onions, cabbage, groundnut paste, ...). To increase their stock supplies, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their ninth group loan cycle.

Mrs. Nah (the second woman standing from left to right in the photo) has a great reputation in selling all kinds of condiments. She plans to use the loan to buy 300 kilos of shallots and cabbages. She sells for cash and credit, through home delivery to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Nah hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 47,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be invested in the business and ensure her home is supplied with condiments.

Like other women in the group, Ms. Nah aims to sustain her activities through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Sinia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Sinia de 44 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde  reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; doña Sinia es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene delante de  la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Doña Sinia tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en: Sinia is 44 years old and lives with her life partner and children.  She has a tortilla stand that is very well-known in the local area.  Sinia has many clients as she sells the best, warm tortillas and offers a very fast service at affordable prices.  Sinia is very enterprising and has a strong will to get ahead.  She has a winning attitude and so always remains ahead of the competition.  Sinia believes that when somebody wants something, they must know how to take risks and that is what makes life worth living.  Sinia wants to take a risk in order to be able to expand her business.  So, she is applying for a loan from "Apoyo Integral" to buy corn in bulk.  Sinia hopes that, through this, she will be able to bring financial stability to her home and will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Transito Francisco

texts.es: Don transito de 48 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz también trabaja de jornal en una finca cerca de su casa cuando la cosecha ha pasado, con las ganancias que obtienen de sus ventas y con el pago de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo d 14 años de edad. Don Transito esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para seguir con su cosecha como: Veneno para plagas, semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. y asi seguirle dando a su familia lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Transito is 48 years old and has been working in farming for 20 years.  This has given him the necessary experience to be able to tend to his crops, mainly corn.  He also works at another farm near his home after the harvest has finished.  With the profits he earns from sales and the money he earns at the farm, Transito is able to cover some household costs.  He lives in his own home with his wife and 14-year-old son.  Transito is applying for a loan to buy necessary supplies to continue with his crops.  He will buy insecticides, seeds, manure, fertilisers and more.  With the loan, he will then be able to continue providing his family with everything they need.

.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, seeds, manure, fertilisers and more.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa de sus padre con su esposa y su madre, el tiene un negocio de peluquería y barbería desde hace 10 años  su padre quien ya murió se lo dejo para que el pudiera seguir trabajando, tienen muchos clientes ya el es una persona muy amable y trabajador su negocio lo tienen ubicado cerca de su vivienda, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar su negocio comprado espejos profesionales, lavamanos, silla reclinable para niños, máquina para cortar pelo, etc. ya que los instrumentos que ocupa ya están un poco dañados y asi el pueda seguir con su trabajo y poder ayudar en los gastos de la casa.
texts.en: The client lives in his parents’ house with his wife and his mother. He has had a hairdresser’s and barber’s shop for ten years.
