His father, who has passed away, left it to him so that he could continue working. He has many clients since he is a very friendly and hard-working person. His business is located close to his home. The client is requesting a loan so he can improve his business by buying professional mirrors, washbasins, a reclining chair for children, hair clippers, etc. The instruments he has are a little damaged; therefore, the loan will allow him to continue with his work and help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase professional mirrors, washbasins, a reclining chair for children, hair clippers, etc

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and fees.

She has operated a business selling charcoal for the past six years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of incorporating firewood into her existing business in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de frazadas, ollas, sartenes, etc. desde hace 2 años tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de buena calidad y a buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida logran cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder surtir su negocio y poder seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: This borrower lives with her life partner and two children in her own house.  She makes a living selling blankets, pots, frying pans and similar items.  She has been doing this for two years and has many customers as she sells good quality products at affordable prices.  With her profits and the help of her partner, she is able to cover some household costs.  This borrower is applying for a loan in order to buy more merchandise in bulk so that she can stock up her business and continue to help with household costs.

loans.use: to buy more blankets, pots and frying pans in bulk.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute in the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 10,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Juan Pastor

texts.es:
Juan, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo por lo que requiere de  más capital de trabajo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agrícolas requeridos y apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Juan is in need of a new loan as he needs more working capital for growing corn and beans.  He will use this loan to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides. 

Juan's last loan helped him to buy necessary farming supplies and to support his family with household costs.  The family's circumstances and financial situation have improved.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides,pesticides and insecticides.

loans.name: Joaquin Alberto

texts.es:
Joaquin, se le presenta la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo  porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para su negocio; este le permitirá comprar camarones, langosta, diversidad de pescado fresco.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a invertir en el negocio y logro adquirir más mercadería; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y su grupo familiar se mantiene.
texts.en:
Joaquin needs a new loan because he requires more working capital for his business. This will allow him to buy shrimps, lobster, and a variety of fresh fish.

The previous loan helped him to invest in the business and he managed to acquire more merchandise. His economic conditions have improved and his family remains the same.

loans.use: to buy shrimps, lobster, and a variety of fresh fish

loans.name: Alishba

texts.en: Alishba, age 37, is involved in the business of stitching clothes. She has been running this business for the past two years to assist her husband whose income is insufficient to meet family expenses. She knows that if only her husband works for their family, they will not be able to earn enough money to meet the expenses of their household and the educational needs of their children. Therefore, she started her own business with the support of Kashf Foundation. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy thread in different colors with packs of needles and ribbons. Then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors with packs of needles and ribbons.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en: Kishwar is a 35-year-old woman and the mother of three children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past two years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy thread in different colors with packs of zippers and buttons to complete the orders of her customers on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Esmilda Espinoza

texts.es: La señora Esmilda, habita en una humilde casa con su pareja quien le ayuda con el negocio que ella desempeña la venta de productos gastronómicos,  único medio de ingresos para ambos, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes, el menor de ellos habita en la misma casa con su compañera de vida y una niña de 4 años, este le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Doña Esmilda es una persona que ha logrado construir su vivienda con esfuerzos propio. Solicita el crédito para cambiar el techo de su cocina y mejorar algunos detalles de esta misma, ya que se acerca el invierno y necesita repararla cuanto antes, para vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Esmilda lives in a modest home with her partner, who helps her with her business. She sells gastronomic products. It is the only source of income for them both. All of her children are of age and are financially independent. The youngest lives in the same house along with his partner and his four-year-old daughter and he helps out with the household expenses. Esmilda has managed to build her home with her own efforts. She is requesting the loan so she can change the roof of her kitchen and improve some of the details in the kitchen since winter is approaching and she needs to repair the roof as soon as possible so they can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corrugated galvanised iron, beams, and other things

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo, se le presenta la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo para invertir, ha logrado una mejor productividad de granos básicos, ganado y cerdos; este le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y asimismo para adquirir concentrado para cerdos y vacas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo, ya que lo invirtió en la agricultura y esto le permitió adquirir mejoras en la cosecha; las condiciones económicas se han optimizado por lo que las ganancias han incrementado y las circunstancias familiares asimismo.
texts.en:
Mateo is seeking a new loan so that he can invest in his business.  He has succeeded in increasing the production of basic grains, cattle, and pigs.  This loan will enable him to buy agricultural items such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and other things like these.  He will also buy food concentrate for the pigs and cattle.

His previous loan helped him invest in his agriculture work and increase his harvest.  His economic conditions have improved and his income has increased.  His personal situation has improved, as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and other items like these - and to buy food for pigs and cows.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 32-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past three years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, upset her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a laborer, but he does not earn enough to support his family by himself. Fatima’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

Fatima is a mother of four children; she needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history. Currently she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demands of her customers. 

She wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira, aged 30, deals in the business of stitching clothes. She is very talented and excels in the work of stitching and has gotten a lot of apparition from her community. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to cover family expenditures alone, so she decided to initiate her own business in her home.  Now, she has attained regular customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Currently she has requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy stitching material such as cloth and spools of thread with packs of buttons in various colors. 

Sumaira dreams of providing a better standard of living to her three children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as cloth and spools of thread with packs of buttons in various colors.

loans.name: Cruz Celedonio

texts.es:
Cruz, 60 años de edad, casado, padre de 7 hijos  , habita en la ciudad de Managua . Él se dedica a reparar llantas, motos y vehículos desde hace tres años puso su taller de mecánica. Con mucho esfuerzo fue comprando sus herramientas de trabajo antes él se dedicaba al trabajo de albañilería pero tiempo después decidió poner sus propio negocio donde goza de una muy buena reputación entre su clientela debida a la calidad de servicio que brinda. 
Hoy está solicitando el crédito para comprar neumáticos, parches, válvulas etc.  Esto le permitirá tener inventario  para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.  Uno de sus proyectos es mejorar la infraestructura  de su negocio y tener un amplio stock de repuestos  para llantas y vehículos.
texts.en:
Cruz, 60, is married and has seven children. He lives in Managua and has been repairing car and motorcycle tires for three years in a mechanical workshop he opened. With effort, he bought the tools he needed.

Cruz used to work as a mason, but decided to open his own business and has now a very good reputation among his clients, thanks to the good quality of his services.

Cruz is requesting a loan to buy inner tubes, patches, valves, etc. This way, he will have enough stock to offer his clients a good service. One of his projects is to make some improvements to his establishment and increase his stock of spare parts.

loans.use: to buy inner tubes, patches and valves.

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en:
Vaqif is 51 years old, married, and a father of two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. Vaqif grows fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants, and other vegetables and fruits. He says even though this business is very hard, he and his wife have been handling the business for 10 years without any difficulty. 

Vaqif grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. His income from vegetable and fruit sales is 150 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as getting more land for cultivation.  He is looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer because people purchase fruit a lot. Now he needs a loan of 1,800 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs. He has a good loan history. This is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Fanta from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is widowed with three children between the ages of seven and 13 years. For the past 10 years, Fanta has had her plastic slipper business. She began her business because she wants to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuations and transportation costs.

Fanta requires a loan in order to purchase more plastic slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Fanta plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Diarrah

texts.fr:
Madame Diarrah est âgée de 57 ans, elle vit dans une grande famille au quartier Lafiala de la ville  de Koutiala. Elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, d’où son attachement aux activités commerciales. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités, présentement elle s’est basée sur l’achat-vente de poissons de mer. Les poissons de mer  sont les plus prisés car son coût est abordable par rapport aux poissons de fleuve.  Pour  pouvoir augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, elle décide de  rejoindre l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y a des années. Après  6 prêts solidaire (prêt de groupe) tous remboursés sans difficulté, elle est à son 2ème prêt  individuel.
 Avec ce prêt  elle compte acheter 8  cartons de poissons, pour stocker en cas de manque de provision chez le fournisseur, ce qui arrive très souvent. Elle  effectue sa vente au bord du goudron dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée  de femmes et d’hommes  au comptant ou à crédit. 
Elle compte  réaliser un profit de 90.000FCFA par mois, qu’elle utilisera  pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans  son activité. 
Elle compte toujours sur les financements  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’agrandissement et la diversification de son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diarrah is 57 years old. She lives in a large family in the Lafiala district of the city of Koutiala. She has not had the opportunity to attend school, which explains her commitment to commercial activities.

After conducting several activities she is currently involved in buying and selling saltwater fish. They are the most popular because they are affordable compared to freshwater fish.

To increase her sales, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution some years ago. After six solidarity loans (group loans) all repaid without difficulty, this is her second individual loan.

With this loan she will buy 8 boxes of fish to store in case the supplier becomes out of stock, which happens very often. She conducts her sales by the roadside in the city of Koutiala, to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash or credit.

She expects to make 90,000 FCFA profit per month, that she will use to repay loan interest to Soro Yiriwaso, meet her personal needs and invest the rest in her business activity.

She still depends on Soro Yiriwaso funding to expand and diversify her business.

loans.use: buy saltwater fish

loans.name: Sonia Petronila

texts.es: Sonia de 60 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad  de Managua , madre de 4 hijos todos mayores de edad. Ella es dueña de una pequeña pulpería, la cual inicio vendiendo caramelos, arroz, frijoles por libras. Fue con este negocio que logro mantener a su familia, sus hijas le han estado apoyando con la venta pues se turnaban entre atender la pulpería y hacer las comprar para surtir el negocio. Hoy está necesitando el crédito para comprar ropa, granos básicos y gaseosas. Antes no vendía ropa pero quiere ir diversificando su negocio agregando mas productos de necesidad entre su clientela. En lo futuro le gustaría agregar una mini tienda de ropa ofreciendo ropa nueva y usada.
texts.en:
Sonia, 60, is originally from Managua and has four adult children. She owns a small grocery store. She started selling sweets, rice and beans by the pound. With this business, she was able to sustain her family and her daughters have helped her to take care of the customers. Before, they took turns; someone would sell, someone would buy supplies to stock the store.

Sonia is requesting a loan to buy clothes, grains and beverages. She did not sell clothes before, but she wants to diversify her business by selling more products that her customers demand. In the future, she would like to add a small store selling new and used clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes, grains and beverages.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married and blessed with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past fifteen years, she has operated a retail business selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs.  

With the KES 35,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is 39 years old and married, but does not have any kids yet. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is growing fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants, and other vegetables and fruits. He says, even though this business is very hard, he and his wife have been handling the business for 10 years without any difficulty. Elnur grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. His income from vegetable and fruit sales is 150 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as to get more lands for cultivation. He is looking forward to the increased sales in the coming summer because people purchase many fruits. Nowadays, he needs a loan of 1,800 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs. He has a good loan history; this is his third loan.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds for his agriculture business.

loans.name: Feima

texts.en:
Feima is 23 years old and single with one child, aged three years. She runs a food stand business in Jui eastern area in Freetown. She was a student, but she dropped out of school because her parents could not afford to pay her school fees. She's been in this business for four years and sells palm oil at Sunday market. She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate financial support to expand her business.

Feima requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase cooking material including palm oil, fish, pepper and cooking seasoning. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her further her education and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to become a banker. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking materials including palm oil, fish, pepper and cooking seasoning for her food stall business.

loans.name: Wakio

texts.en:
Wakio is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase five bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Madame MINATA est âgée de 51 ans environ, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit  avec son mari et leurs enfants à Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
MINATA n’a pas eu la chance de faire des longues études, ce qui justifie son intérêt pour les activités génératrices de revenus à savoir l’achat et vente de tissus, Bazin et autres depuis plusieurs ans. MINATA est très bien sollicitée par ses clients.  Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a plus de 8 ans. Elle est a son 7ème prêt  individuel, dont les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des marchandises constituées des pièces de tissus, bazins teintés et des draps de lit. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et Koutiala, elle effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes en général, en détail, au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA, qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, participer aux charges quotidiennes de sa famille et poursuivre son activité avec le reste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Minata is about 51 years old, married with five children. She lives with her ​​husband and their children in Koutiala (Sikasso region).

Minata did not have the opportunity to conduct long-term studies. This explains her interest in income-generating activities, namely buying and selling Bazin and other types of fabrics over the past several years.

Minata is very much in demand by her customers. To increase the size of her business and satisfy her customers, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution more than 8 years ago. This is her seventh individual loan, and the preceding ones were properly reimbursed.

With this new loan she intends to buy woven fabrics, dyed bazins and bed sheets. She get her supplies from Burkina Faso and Koutiala, and sells retail in the city of Koutiala, to a clientele of mainly women, for cash and credit.

She expects to make monthly profits of 40,000 FCFA she will use to repay the loan, participate in her family's daily expenses, and pursue her business activity with the remainder.

loans.use: buy various goods

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is 57-years-old. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a hard-working person who takes care of her family by doing business in animal husbandry. Zahida raises cattle to sell meat. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her husband supports her in the business. The business takes a lot of effort, but together they run it successfully. She sells the meat in the central bazaar where the demand for meat is high. People in Azerbaijan consume plenty of meat because it is used in most dishes. Some traditional meals like kebabs, dolma and others require beef in their preparation. Her profit is 130 AZN monthly. Zashida is applying for new loan of 1,500 AZN in order to expand the business by buying new calves. She plans to raise these calves, fatten them, and sell more meat for the coming traditional holidays, when the demand for beef will increase. This is her fourth credit.

loans.use: to expand the business by buying new calves.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 60 years old and widowed with six children. Two of her children are going to school. She runs a food stand business in Jui eastern area in Freetown.

She's been in this business for the past 35 years. She sells fish, palm oil, pepper and cooking seasoning. She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate financial support to expand her business.
 
Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase cooking material including palm oil, fish, pepper and cooking seasoning. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to change her status of living and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to improve her standard of living before she dies. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking material including palm oil, fish, pepper and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Megeorge

texts.en:
Megeorge is a married woman with three children. She lives in her own house that has electricity and no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food stuff of maize flour, and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu comes again to you for another loan and she appreciates the previous loan. She cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites food leftovers leading to losses as her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, vive en la ciudad de Managua, es madre de 4 hijos  que viven independientes.  Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y una pulpería. Ella inicio su negocio con la venta de tortillas después vendiendo café, tortilla y queso fue asi que poco a poco le fue agregando productos hasta formar una mini pulpería. Actualmente tiene su pulpería y venta de tortillas ya tiene 7 años con este negocio en ocasiones también se dedica a vender comida para conseguir otros ingresos. 
Esta solicitando el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz, leña, gaseosas, detergentes, cloro, jabones etc. Todos productos que a diario le solicitan sus clientes y los cuales no pueden faltar. Uno de sus proyectos es trasladar su pulpería aun ligar más amplio dentro de vivienda pues su propósito es que su negocio crezca y prospere cada dia.
texts.en: Isabel, who lives in the city of Managua, is the mother of 4 children who have now left home.  She earns her living selling tortillas and running a grocery shop.  She started out just selling tortillas and later began to sell coffee, tortillas and cheese before gradually built up her range of goods until she had a mini grocery shop.  She has now been running the tortilla and grocery business for 7 years and occasionally also sells food as a means of generating additional income.  She is applying the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, firewood, fizzy drinks, washing powder, bleach, soap etc.  - products which her customers ask for everyday and which they cannot do without.  One of her plans is to transfer her grocery shop to bigger premises in her home, as a means of ensuring the continued growth and prosperity of her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, firewood, fizzy drinks, washing powder, bleach, soap etc.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 54 years old and married with four children.

Bernadeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Bernadeth has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Bernadeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married and has been blessed with three children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past the six years, she has operated a vegetable kiosk business, selling green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She sells primarily to local neighbors. She dreams of expanding and establishing a shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 41 years old and married with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenelyn has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, slippers, bags, towels and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, slippers, bags, towels and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Âgée de  36 ans, Fatoumata est une célibataire sans enfant, qui vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans la ville de Koutiala. Elle n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études, raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis à bas âge, notamment l’achat vente de Sounbala.  Au Mali, le Sounbala est l’un des condiments le plus important et très prisé par les femmes,  pour  cela cette  activité lui procure beaucoup de bénéfice car elle peut vendre plus de 2 gros paniers dans la semaine.  Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, elle a sollicité la collaboration avec  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de 4 ans.   Elle a pris 3 prêts dans le groupe (prêt solidaire) tous  remboursés  correctement  et elle est à son 3ème  prêt en individuel dont les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 10 paniers  de Sounbala   auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente à Kayes à une clientèle  de femmes  au comptant.  Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement de son prêt, subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
36 years old, Fatoumata is a single person without children, who lives in a traditional family in the city of Koutiala. She has not had the opportunity to pursue studies, why is why she focused on retail commerce since an early age, including the purchase and sale of Sounbala.

In Mali, Sounbala is one of the most important condiments, and highly prized by women. This explains why this activity gives her much profit as she can sell more than two large baskets a week.

To increase her working capital in order to expand her business, she sought cooperation with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution over 4 years ago. She participated in three group loans, all reimbursed correctly, and is now on her third individual loan, having fully reimbursed the previous ones.

With this loan she intends to buy 10 baskets of Sounbala from wholesalers. Sales are made in Kayes to women customers, for cash.

She expects monthly profits of 50,000 FCFA she intends to use to repay the loan, meet her personal needs and reinvest the remainder in her activity.

loans.use: buy sounbala (popular condiment made from nere seeds)

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 40 years old, married and has six children, three of whom are in school. 

Mary Jean is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
Normita is 44 years old and has three children, who are in school. She is married. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Normita has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Normita would like to save money, so she can continue to send her children to school and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small plot of land.

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Patria is 63 years old and widowed with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

She has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from charcoal retail.

Patria aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a married woman with four children. She lives at her own house that has electricity and no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a food kiosk business selling food stuff of maize flour, and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Arnabeth

texts.en: Arnabeth is 33 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future, Arnabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 20 years old and single, and she has no child for now. She runs a food stand business in Jui, to the east of Freetown.

She's been in this business for 2 years and sells fish, palm oil, onions and cooking seasoning. She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate finances to expand.
 
Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase cooking materials, including palm oil, fish, onions and cooking seasoning. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her child and repay her loan. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking materials, including palm oil, fish, onions and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Eliuth De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Eliuth, es una joven de 23 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Managua, soltera. Ella se dedica a vender zapatos y chinelas. Empezó su negocio con ayuda de su papa quien le dio capital  salía a vender fuera de la ciudad para hacer más clientes y vender más. Tiene 5 años de tener este negocio el cual año con año ha ido creciendo, este negocio lo comparte con su mama y su abuelita pues son las personas que le ayudan a atender la venta de zapatos y chinelas.  
Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar zapatos y sandalias de diferentes estilos y tamaños. Ella anhela tener su propio local para no tener que alquilar y terminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Eliuth is a 23 year old single woman who lives in Managua.  She is engaged in selling shoes and slippers.  She started her business with the help of her father who gave her the capital.  She sells her merchandise outside of the city to expand her customer base and make more sales.  She has had this business for five years and it has been growing year after year.  She shares this business with her mother and grandmother who help her sell the shoes and slippers.  She is requesting the loan to purchase shoes and sandals in various styles and sizes.  She wants to have her own business location so that she doesn’t have to rent space and she also wishes to complete her university studies.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 43 years old, married and has 3 children between the ages of 12 years and 24 years. She runs a wood business in Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She started the business because she wants to improve her standard of living. 

She's been in this business for 4 years and sells coal and wood at her house.  She describes her major hardship as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Kadaitu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more coal and wood to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to change her business clothing business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more coal and wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Ramatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has 2 children between the ages of 12 years and 18 years.  Her children are attending school. She started a business to get earnings for the daily survival of her family.
 
Ramatu runs a food stand business, she sells cooking seasonings, oil and rice. She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week.  Ramatu says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes purchasing power is very slow.

Ramatu has requested a loan in order to buy food ingredients like cooking seasonings, oil and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her life. In the future, she plans to expanded her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food ingredients like cooking seasonings, oil and rice.

loans.name: Amarilis Del Socorro

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo de la ciudad de Portoviejo Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “San Eduardo”, cerca de este lugar hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy frecuentado ya que hay aéreas para hacer deporte y se puede disfrutar de la naturaleza.

En este lugar vive la señora Amarilis, es casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Desde los doce años aprendió corte y confección en un Academia de esta ciudad. 

Doña Amarilis es una muy buena esposa que para ganar sus propios ingresos se dedica a la confección, trabaja en un taller de costura cerca de su casa de lunes a viernes y en su casa en las noches y fines de semana trabaja en un pequeño taller de costura que tiene, allí confecciona todo tipo de ropa en especial ropa de mujer, aunque le encanta coser ropa deportiva, lleva más de 20 años con esta actividad que le ha permitido, sacar adelante a su familia.

Lleva más de 11 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado. Con este crédito va a comprar telas, hilos, cierres y varios materiales más para confeccionar sus prendas. 

Su sueño es tener un gran taller más grande.
texts.en:
Every fortnight in San Eduardo street in the city of Portoviejo, Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, the members of the “San Eduardo” Community Bank meet. There is a beautiful park nearby which is full of people because there are areas to play sport and enjoy nature.

This is where Señora Amarilis lives. She is married and has four children, who have already grown up. From the age of 12 she learned dressmaking in an academy of this city. 

Amarilis is a good wife who works as a dressmaker in order to make her own money. She works in a sewing workshop close to her home from Monday to Friday, and in her home at night and weekends in a small workshop she has. There, she makes all different kinds of clothing, especially women's clothes, although she loves sports clothing. She has been in this activity for over 20 years, which has enabled her to support her family.

She has been a member of the Community Bank for over 11 years, and she likes it because of the help she has been given. She is going to use this loan to buy fabric, threads, zips and other materials to make her clothing.

Her dream is to have a bigger workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, zips and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 23-year-old Marie from Waterloo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married and has 2 children between the ages of 3 and 7 years. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2005, Marie established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are lack of finances to operate her business and transportation problems.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to open a big palm oil store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is in her late thirties, married and has 6 children between the ages of 3 years and 20 years. She runs a food stand business in the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells fish, pepper and cooking season. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation difficulties and inadequate financesl to expand her business.
 
Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase food supplies including palm oil and fish. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies including palm oil and fish

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Isatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 3 years and 20 years. She began this business because she wants to stop sitting at home as a house wife and create a source of income to support the home.

Isatu runs a general store where she sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soaps. She has been running this business since 1996. She works at the business every day, from morning to night.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soaps. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soaps.

loans.name: Sahr L.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Micrfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from the township of Waterloo, in western Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has applied for a loan of 13,000,000 SLL in order to meet their most immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Sahr is the featured leader of this group of teachers. Sahr was born in Kono, in eastern Sierra Leone 43 years ago. He is married to a housewife and the couple has 4 children, 2 of whom are attending primary schools, 1 in secondary and 1 in college. Sahr is a professional teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 21 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school/college fees for this children

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Hawa from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has 2 children ages 6 and 14. She began this business because she wants to empower her life and children.

Hawa runs a general store where she sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soaps. She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business every day moving around the community to introduce her goods.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Hawa has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soaps. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soaps

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 43 years old and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ethel requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Ethel has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ethel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia Maclovia

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “San Eduardo”, cerca de este lugar hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy frecuentado ya que hay aéreas para hacer deporte y se puede disfrutar de la naturaleza.

En este lugar vive la señora Lilia, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y el menor estudia en colegio, dos de hijos aun viven con ella. Es modista desde muy joven, estudio corte y confección en una academia de esta ciudad. 

Doña Lilia es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante y poder ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, ella tiene un taller en su casa lugar en el cual confecciona todo tipo de ropa, lo que más le gusta es  hacer ropa de  mujer y camisas para hombre, trabaja todos los días y cuando hay bastante trabajo casi todo el día, tiene dos empleadas que trabajan con ella  a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal por su trabajo, leva mas de 15 años con su taller el cual le permite salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales que se requieren para la costura. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos para salir adelante. 

Sus sueños son que nunca le falte trabajo y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the “San Eduardo” Communal Bank meet in Portoviejo, “Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos” [the City of the Royal Tamarinds] on San Eduardo Street.  Near this area, there is a beautiful park that is very popular because there are areas to play sports and people can enjoy nature.

Lilia lives in this city.  She is married and has three children, two are adults and the youngest is a student.  Two of her children still live with her. She has been a dressmaker since she was very young, and studied the craft at an academy in this city.

Lilia is a very feisty woman and believes in standing on her own two feet to get ahead and be able to help her children with their education.  She has a workshop in her home, where she makes all types of clothing.  She enjoys making women’s clothing and men’s shirts the most.  She works every day and almost all day when there is enough work.  She has two employees that work with her and she pays them a weekly salary for their work. She has had her workshop, which allows her to get ahead, for more than fifteen years.

She will use this loan to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, and other materials that she needs for sewing.  Lilia is the founder of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans provided help her to get ahead.  Her dreams are that she never lacks work and enjoys good health.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Felix tiene 47 años, está casado con Regina de 40 años con quien logró construir una vivienda hecha a base de adobe.Hace 35 años se dedica al cultivo de cacao y otros productos de la zona.Posee un terreno agrícola de 2 hectáreas en donde trabaja con ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos quienes lo apoyan en tareas menores.Comenta que al inicio fue difícil obtener dinero para mantener a su familia porque no tenía un terreno propio para cultivar y solo laboraba como trabajador en distintos terrenos de su localidad. Con el tiempo ahorró lo necesario y compró un terreno de cacao a buen precio a un amigo suyo. Ya con un terreno propio para trabajar incremento sus ganancias y pudo comprar más terrenos.Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus parcelas junto a su esposa mientras envía a sus hijos al colegio. Trata de mantener sus plantaciones en buenas condiciones usando abono orgánico para obtener buenos productos. Suele vender sus productos a los acopiadores del pueblo y por ello contratar un transporte particular con el cual traslada los sacos con granos de cacao seco esperando recuperar el dinero que invirtió y obtener ganancias adicionales.Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y agradece la oportunidad que se le brinda para continuar adelante.Desea en esta primera ocasión contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para comprar un terreno agrícola y seguir con la producción de cacao.
texts.en:
Felix is 47 years old and married to Regina, who is 40.  The couple managed to build their own house from adobe.

Felix has been growing cacao and other regional produce for the past 35 years.  He has a small, 2 hectare, plot of farmland where he works with his wife and his children who help him with the smaller tasks.  He says that at first it was difficult to make enough money to support his family because he didn't have any land of his own to cultivate and worked on other people's land in his area instead.  Over time, he saved up the money he needed to buy a plot of cacao land at a good price from a friend of his.  With his own plot of land to work, he increased his profits and was able to buy more land.  Every morning Felix heads for his fields together with his wife and sends the kids to school.  He tries to keep his land in good condition, using organic fertilizer to obtain good crops.  He usually sells his produce to local wholesale dealers.  In order to do this he hires a private vehicle which he uses to transport his sacks full of dry cacao beans, hoping to recoup the money he invested and make additional profits.  

This is the first loan that Felix has received a loan through Kiva and he is grateful for the opportunity he is being given as it will help him to continue moving forward.  He would like a loan for 3,000 soles so that he can buy a plot of farmland and continue growing his cacao.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 38 years old, married and has 5 children between the ages of 8 and 19. She runs a palm oil business in Waterloo 2 Eastern area in Freetown. She started the business because she wants to be self-independent. 

She's been in this business since 2009 and sells palm oil at a particular market place.  She describes her major hardship as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to open a big gari store  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel vive en casa de su suegra en la zona de alto San pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como enfermera particular pero además se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la marca Yanbal.

El crédito que solicita es para refaccionar un par de habitaciones que tiene en un terreno que tiene en Villa Copacabana.

El sueño de Mabel es poder hacer estudiar a su hijo ya que quedo viuda muy joven y terminar la construcción de su pequeña casita.
texts.en:
Mabel lives in her mother-in-law's house in the Alto San Pedro are in the city of La Paz. She works as a private nurse buy she also sells Yanbal beauty products.  

The loan she is asking for is to repair some room she has one some land she owns in Villa Copacabana.

Mabel's dream is to educate her son, since she was widowed very young, as well as finish building her little house.

loans.use: to pay for repairing a couple of rooms on some land she owns.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro, tiene la edad  de 37 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y si es posible orgánicos y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de buena calidad que se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Isidro, aged 37, is married and lives with his wife and children, who are his main priority. With the loan, he intends to buy fertilizers and if possible manure and other things to apply to his crop to have good growth. He will also buy high quality seeds that adapt well to the local conditions as well as pay for labor costs to apply the products and help once they have good development. This way he can ensure that it turns out well. what he intends to do is take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions in the area for this crop as well as out his years of experience with various grains into use. He also wants to buy the best products of the best quality so his crop will develop well and be healthy and have a good harvest and good production in the short term. He wants to use the income from the harvest he hopes to obtain on his family's well being and education and reach some family goals as well as keep investing in his crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with more ease of payment and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy, tiene la edad  de 21 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres  y su hermanos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol la cual tenga buenas condiciones y características que se adapten bien a la zona, además fertilizantes y si es posible orgánicos y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Freddy is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings who are his main priority in life.  He plans to use his loan to buy bean seeds which have good characteristics and grow well in his area.  He will also buy fertilizers - organic if possible - and other products to use on his crops, as well as paying workers to apply these products and tend his fields once things are growing   This will ensure that a good job is done.

Freddy plans to make the most of the good weather and soil conditions in his area to grow his crops.  He will also put into practice the several years of experience which he has growing basic grains.  He would like to be able to buy the best quality products he can so that his crops grow strong and healthy and he obtains a decent harvest and good short-term production.  He will use the income he hopes to make from his harvest to provide for his family's well-being and education, as well as achieving some family goals and continuing to invest in his crops.

This is the first loan that Freddy has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any previous loans from state banks.  FUDECOSUR have given him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his bean crop

loans.name: Koma

texts.en:
Koma is 53 years old and married. She has 2 children between the ages of 9 and 17. She runs a charcoal business in Waterloo 2 Eastern area in Freetown. She started this business because her husband is an old man and she needed to create income to sustain her home. She has no option other than to do business. 

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells charcoal and wood at her house. She describes her major hardships as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Koma requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to change her business to a grocery store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es madre soltera y vive en la zona de Achumani de la ciudad de La Paz, vive con su hijo en una casa humilde y se sustentan con la venta de la mercadería de su librería. Ella necesita el crédito para aumentar la mercadería de su negocio (comprará cuadernos, lápices, puntabolas, gomas, etc.) y así tener más variedad de productos.

El sueño de Josefina es poder darle una buena educación a su hijo y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina is a single mother and lives in Achumani, in the city of La Paz.  She lives with her son in a humble home and they provide for themselves by selling merchandise in her stationery store.  Josefina needs this loan to increase her business merchandise.  She will buy exercise books, pencils, ballpoint pens, erasers, etc. which will give her a greater range of products to sell.

Josefina's dreams are to provide her son with a good education and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy exercise books, pencils, erasers and other items for her stationery store so that she has a better stock of products to offer her customers

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía tiene 31 años,  es madre soltera de dos hijos de 01 y 11 años de edad respectivamente. Vive en una casa hecha de madera la cual le cedieron sus padres para el bienestar de su familia.Vive en un comunidad de la selva  y se dedica a la agricultura produciendo alguno de los productos más rentables de su localidad como cacao orgánico y barbasco.Inicialmente tenía un pequeño terreno agrícola que recibió de sus padres como herencia para mantener económicamente a su familia porque desafortunadamente el padre de sus hijos la abandonó asumiendo ella los gastos de su hogar, pero en vez de lamentarse se sintió muy motivada y con el paso de los años logró ahorrar para comprar otra parcela en donde empezó a sembrar árboles de cacao.Su principal deseo es seguir trabajando con la motivación que la caracteriza para adquirir otro terreno e iniciarse en la producción de café y con las futuras ganancias cumplir su sueño de construir su vivienda a base de material noble para el bienestar de sus hijos.Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para el desarrollo de su actividad laboral.En está oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles y comprar sacos de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Sofia is 31 years old, and is a single mother of two children aged 1 and 11 respectively. She lives in a wooden house given to her by her parents for the wellbeing of her family. She lives in a forest community and makes a living in agriculture producing some of the most profitable products in her area, such as organic cocoa and mullein. Initially, she had a small plot of agricultural land which she inherited from her parents to support her family financially, since unfortunately, the father of her children left her, leaving her to pay all the household expenses. However, rather than feeling sorry or herself, she felt very motivated, and over the years she managed to save up to buy another plot of land where she began to plant cocoa trees. 

Her biggest wish is to continue working with the motivation that characterizes her, in order to buy another piece of land and start producing coffee, and with the future earnings achieve her dream of building a home out of high-quality materials for her children's wellbeing. This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels very grateful for the opportunity provided to her to develop her working activities. On this occasion, she would like 2,000 soles to buy organic compost to fertilize her plantations.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 48 years old and married with six children between the ages of eight and 20 years. Two of her children are going to school. She runs a food stand business in Jui eastern area in Freetown.

She's been in this business for 20 years and sells local food such as foo foo, and cassava, palm oil and pepper. She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate financial support to expand her business.
 
Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase cooking material including palm oil, pepper and cassava. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to renovate her house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking material including palm oil, pepper and cassava.

loans.name: Vannia

texts.es:
Vannia vive en casa de sus abuelos en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, en la parte inferior de la casa le dieron una habitación la cual instaló una tienda de abarrotes para poder tener ingresos y mantener a su hijo

El crédito que solicita es para poder aumentar su capital y surtir la tienda y mejorar sus ingresos (comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, sodas en cantidades para mejorar sus costo).

El sueño de Vannia es poder tener un almacén bien surtido y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Vannia lives in her grand parents' house in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. They gave her a room in the lower part of the house where she set up a small grocery store to have some income and support her son. 

The loan she is asking for is to increase her capital and stock her store and improve her income (she will buy rice, sugar, pasta, and soda in quantities that will improve their cost).

Vannia's dream is to be able to have a well stocked store and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pasta, rice and more to stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Adama from Waterloo, to the east of Freetown. She is married and has 4 children. She has two additional dependents at home. She began this business to create a source of income to take care of the children.

Adama runs a grocery business at her house. She sells cigarettes, cola nuts, and bread. She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business from 8:00am to 6:00pm. She says despite her hardship, she desires to educate her children and become successful.

Adama has requested a loan in order to purchase bags of rice, sardines, butter, and soft drinks for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent residence for her family (at present, they are sleeping in a single room) and increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, sardines, butter and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 30 años y esta casada con Severo, tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en una casa hecha de madera hace muchos años.Maritza se dedica a la agricultura con apoyo de su esposo cultiva algunos productos de la zona como cacao y café orgánico.Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender  ganado pero al sufrir un pequeño accidente lo dejo temporalmente y con el dinero que ahorró hasta entonces compró un terreno agrícola para intentar crecer económicamente de nuevo.Su trabajo consiste en mantener en buen estado sus cultivos y así obtener cosechas de calidad, suele usar abono orgánico para incrementar la calidad de sus frutos, además contrata jornaleros del lugar para limpiar la maleza que crece constantemente.Su trabajo se complica cuando llega la temporada de lluvias porque sus parcelas son terrenos arcillosos y eso impide que desarrolle sus tareas cotidianas con normalidad.Luego de cosechar los frutos, a fin de campaña los seca y con la ayuda de un vehiculo de carga lleva los sacos de cacao hasta la ciudad donde vende sus productos a los compradores de la zona que le pagan buenos precios.Su principal objetivo es construir su vivienda a base de ladrillos y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada ya que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Desea contar con 2,500 nuevo soles para comprar sacos de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 30 years old and married to Severo.  She has three children who live with her in a wooden house which was built many years ago.  Maritza and her husband work as farmers, growing regional crops such as organic cacao and coffee.  In the past, Maritza used to sell livestock but she suffered a small accident which stopped her working temporarily.  She used some money that she had been saving up to buy a plot of farmland so that she could attempt to start improving her finances again.  Her work consists of keeping her crops in good condition so that she obtains good-quality harvests.  She normally uses organic fertilizer to increase the quality of her fruit.  She also hires local laborers to get rid of the weeds that grow constantly.  Maritza's work becomes more complicated when the rainy season arrives because she has clay soil and this prevents her from doing her daily tasks normally.  After harvesting her fruits at the end of the season, she dries them and, with the help of a truck, she transports the sacks of cacao to the city where she sells them to local buyers who pay her a good price.  Her main goal is to build her house from bricks and to provide her whole family with a better quality of life.

This is Maritza's first loan through Kiva.  She feels very grateful for the opportunity she is being given and pledges to make all her loan repayments on time.  She is requesting a loan for 2,500 soles to buy sacks of organic fertilizer with which to fertilize her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Samuel Mary's Group

texts.en:
Meet with this team of primary school teachers from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone near the capital city of Freetown. This team of teachers has come to SMT, Kiva’s oldest field partner in Sierra Leone, to apply for a loan of SLL 4,400,000. This loan will empower these teachers to tackle their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar will deduct the amount they owe and repay SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

Samuel is the featured leader of this team. He is a native of Yele village. At age 40, Samuel is a father and a husband. He has been in the teaching profession for 18 years now. Samuel has requested a loan of SLL 2,000,000 in order to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, cements, rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling place.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, cements, rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling place.

loans.name: Tigidankay

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Tigidankay from Waterloo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children, ages 5 years and 15 years, who are currently attending school. Her husband is a chief but he has four wives, so Tigidankay wants to be self-dependent and create her own income to support her children.  

In 2000, Tigidankay established her palm oil business.  She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are the lack of finances to operate her business and transportation problems.

Tigidankay requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and increase her business. In the future, Tigidankay plans to open a big palm oil store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 59-year-old single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 21,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Edna has been in this business for three years. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Memuna from Waterloo, in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 9 years and 18 years. Three of her children attend school. She started in business to get daily survival for her family.
 
Memuna runs a food stand business where she sells cooking seasonings, groundnuts and peppers. She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business 9 hours per day and 7 days per week.  Memuna says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

She has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil, rice, groundnuts and peppers. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like oil, rice, groundnuts, peppers, and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Adama from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 2 children, ages 14 years and 17 years. She has two additional dependents at home.  She began this business because she wants to have a permanent source of income and educate her children.

Adama runs a cosmetics shop within a busy market area.  She sells necklaces, rings, nail polish and bracelets. She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business from 8:00am to 6:00pm.  At present she is faced with insufficient capital to run her business.

She has requested a loan in order to purchase necklaces, rings, nail polish and bracelets for resale. The extra income from this loan will help her to have a permanent residence and increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase necklaces, rings, nail polish and bracelets for resale.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Rugiatu from Port Loko in the Northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 10 years and 22 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2003, Rugiatu established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she wanted to help her community through medical care. She works at the business 7 days per week and 15 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is the expiration of drugs.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy medicinal drugs. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to build a clinic. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy medicinal drugs.

loans.name: Samuel B.'s Group

texts.en:
In the picture above are a group of primary school teachers located in Waterloo, a town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers is applying for a loan of SLL 11,400,000 from Kiva’s field partner, SMT. School staff and other salaried workers normally come to SMT to apply for loans. 

With these loans, they are empowered to meet certain financial challenges that they cannot meet, left alone with their salaries. However, with the help of SMT/Kiva lenders' loans, some of these borrowers will be able to pay school fees for their children, invest in businesses, buy housebuilding materials or pieces of furniture, etc. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar directly deducts their total repayment amounts owed and repays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

The featured leader of this team is Samuel. Thirty-eight-year-old Samuel is a native of Kalangba village, in northern Sierra Leone. He is a husband to a businesswoman and a father of 6 children, 4 of whom are attending primary school and the others are still not of school-going age. Samuel is a professional school teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 11 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for himself. Samuel is pursuing further studies in college.

(These teachers came to the office in two separate batches to collect the loan, hence two different photos attached together.)

loans.use: to pay college fees for himself. Samuel is pursuing further studies in college.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan, de 30 años de edad, soltero, de oficio carpintero, habita en la ciudad de Estelí su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación.  Empezó su actividad con el apoyo de su hermano que  se encuentra en otro país él le ha dado la mano para empezar a formar su taller de carpintería, tiene dos trabajadores que le ayudan con el proceso de pintura y corte de madera, él se dedica al proceso de elaboración de muebles en el cual le ha ido bien ya que hace muy bien su trabajo. El propósito de crédito es para la instalación del sistema eléctrico de su taller poner brakers y cables.  Sus metas futuras son tener su taller funcionado completamente con todas sus máquinas su meta próxima es el sistema eléctrico.
texts.en:
Juan, 30, is single and lives in the city of Estelí. He has a workshop at home, where he works as a carpenter. He started this activity supported by his brother, who lives abroad and has helped him to establish his workshop. Juan employs two assistants that help him to cut and paint the wood. He makes furniture, and he is very good at it.

Juan is requesting a loan to install an electric control system (circuit breakers and cables). His goals for the future are to have a full-running workshop with all the equipment in place. His short term goal is to install the electric control system.

loans.use: to buy circuit breakers and electric cables for his workshop.

loans.name: Alice C.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of able and dedicated teachers from Benguma in western Sierra Leone, near the capital city of Freetown. They are applying for a loan of SLL 10,500,000 in order to meet their most urgent financial challenges. At the end of each month they can repay the loan, using their salaries.
