It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Alice is the featured leader of this group. A native of Waterloo town, the 51-year-old has 2 children – 1 of whom is still in college and the other is no longer in school.  Alice has been a professional teacher for 35 years now. She has requesed this loan in order to pay college fees for her child.  

(These teachers came to the office in two separate batches to collect the loan, hence two different photos attached together)

loans.use: to pay college fees for her child.

loans.name: Tojiboy

texts.ru: Тожибой добродушный мужчина в возрасте 44 лет. Он женат и имеет одну дочку. Тожибой вместе с женой и дочерью живет в сельской  местности. И для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание, он занимается собственным бизнесом. Тожибой имеет большой опыт в сфере откармливания рогатого скота, а также в сфере выращивания сельхоз культуры. Основной доход он получает от откармливания и продажи скота. Жена помогает ему в этом деле. Днем она работает в дехканском хозяйстве, а вечером и утром ухаживает за скотом и доит коров. Каждый день коровы дают по 10 литров молока, затем жена продает это молоко местному населению. А Тожибой, параллельно с животноводством, выращивает сельхоз культуру, и потом он также продаёт полученный урожай. Для выращивания сельхоз культуры Тожибой имеет земельный участок площадью 2 га. Это дело приносит ему хороший дополнительный заработок. Сейчас Тожибой хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота для получения большей прибыли. Его дочь в данный момент заканчивает школу и будет поступать в Университет, поэтому Тожибою необходимы денежные средства для оплаты её образования. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит и на эти деньги закупить больше голов скота для дальнейшей продажи. Тожибой заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Tojiboy is a kindhearted fellow of 44. He is married and has one daughter. He lives with his wife and daughter out in the countryside. He earns a living running his own business. He is very experienced in raising cattle and farming. Most of his income comes from raising and selling livestock. His wife helps him with the business; in the afternoon, she works at a community farm, and in the evening and morning she looks after the animals and milks the cows. Each cow produces 10 liters of milk a day, and his wife sells it to people who live nearby. Along with raising animals, Tojiboy grows crops on a two-square hectare plot of land, and sells the harvest. This business brings him additional income. Now Tojiboy wants to increase his cattle herd to earn a large profit. His daughter is graduating from school and is going to enter the university, so Tojiboy needs money to pay for her education. Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy more cattle so he can resell them later on. Tojiboy thanks Arvand for its support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Kalamereh Ii Group

texts.en:
Adikalie is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Adikalie was born 40 years ago in Kambia town in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a housewife and the couple has 5 children – 3 in primary school and 2 in secondary schools. 

For many years now, Adikalie has been selling bags – school bags, travelers’ bags, etc. He has requested this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of bags to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of bags to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is a 62-year-old man. He is married with three children, and he lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. He has owned and managed a computer shop for three years, earning 10,000 PHP a month for a living. In order to purchase supplies and accessories, he borrowed 20,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which he joined last year. Edgar wants to expand his business and save a portion of his profits for the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and accessories.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina vive en casa propia con sus hijos pero como la casa es grande ellos viven independientes, percibe una renta de jubilada, con la cual se mantiene, además para mejorar sus ingresos puso una tienda de barrio en su domicilio.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, poder surtir su mercadería y de esta manera no perder a sus clientes y además mejorar sus ingresos. La anterior vez que solicitó un préstamo de Kiva, éste le sirvió mucho pues pudo mejorar su stock. Ahora desea hacer lo mismo pues su mercadería ya se vendió y necesita comprar más para surtir la tienda. Necesita comprar más arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros.

El sueño de Rina se cumplio ya que era tener su casita y dar comodidad  a sus hijos, ahora está contenta con lo que hizo.
texts.en:
Rina lives in her own home with her children, but as it's a large house, they live independently. She receives a pension, with which she supports herself, and to boost her earnings she set up a neighborhood store in her home.

She is requesting a loan to increase her capital, stock her store and in doing so avoid losing customers and increase her income. The last time she requested a loan from Kiva, it helped her a great deal as she was able to improve her stock. She now wants to do the same again since her merchandize has already been sold and she needs to buy more items to stock the store. She needs to buy rice, sugar, pasta and other goods.

Rina achieved her dream, which was to own a home and make her children comfortable, and now she is content with what she has done.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica es madre soltera y vive en alquiler en la zona de Achumani de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja vendiendo pollo a la broaster en la puerta de su domicilio y además cuida sola a sus hijos durante todo el día.

Verónica requiere el crédito para poder comprar mejores instrumentos de cocina que facilitarían su trabajo, pues la máquina que tiene es muy antigua y está fallando; también necesigta comprar un pequeño horno para cocinar papas, camotes, yuca y otros insumos que acompañan a sus pollos.  Esto también  le daría más tiempo con sus hijos.

El sueño de Verónica es expandir su negocio y poder conseguir un hogar propio.
texts.en:
Verónica is a single mother and lives in a rental house in Achumani, in the city of La Paz.  She works selling broaster chicken from her doorway.  She also cares for her children throughout the day.

Verónica needs this loan to buy better kitchen appliances which will make her work easier as the machine she currently has is very old and keeps breaking down.  She also needs to buy a small oven for cooking potatoes, sweet potatoes, cassava and other items that she serves alongside her chicken.  This would give her more time to spend with her children.

Verónica's dreams are to expand her business and to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy a chicken broaster and a small oven

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey is married with 3 children. He is 31 years old and lives in Pangabuan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Jeffrey sells grocery goods and agrivet supplies for hogs to earn a living, and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, he earns about PHP 30,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase groceries and agrivet supplies for hogs. Jeffrey became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, he hopes to use his profits to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is a widow with seven children. She is 62 years old and lives in Kinuman, Ozamis City. 

To earn a living, Felina plants and harvests corn and bananas for sale. She's been in this business for 30 years, earning 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. Now, she is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future, Felina wants to make improvements to her house and to have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married and has six children. She is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and cares for pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. 

She has requested a loan amount of PHP 14,900 to invest in her piggery business. Alma has been a member of PMPC for one year. She hopes to improve her living conditions in the future by using the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy piglets for her pig raising business.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia is 60 years old and married with six children. She is from Katipunan, Sinacaban. For 18 years, Anatalia has owned and operated a general store where she sells a variety of products to earn a living.  

Anatalia been a member of GDMPC since 2007 and is now requesting a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to purchase additional inventory. In the future, she wants to improve her business and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 54 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines.  Remedios is a farmer, raising watermelons, which she has been doing for five years. 

Remedios is requesting a loan from PMPC for 10,500 PHP, which she will use to buy watermelon seedlings and fertilizer for agricultural production. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her family's living conditions by using the income of her agricultural production.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Marga Indah Ternak Group

texts.en:
After obtaining satisfactory results in the previous loan period, the Marga Indah Ternak group continues borrowing. The current loan will be used to purchase piglets and feed and repair cages.

Ni Komang will use the loan to buy feed and repair cages. Ni Komang has six piglets for fattening and they are scheduled to be sold in five months. Ni Komang and her husband also plan to raise cattle. With the profits she earned last period, she bought a calf. She hopes the welfare of her family will be better, and if all goes well, she will increase the number of cows to be maintained.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed and repair cages.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is married with four sons and daughters. Ermelinda is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ermelinda is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan amount of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizer for the farm production. 

Ermelinda has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Ermelinda hopes to improve her living conditions by using the income of the farm's corn production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm production.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда женщина 48 лет. Мавлуда замужем и мать 4 детей. Муж Мавлуды находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Мавлуда очень заботливая, добрая, чистоплотная женщина. Она помогает своему мужу в содержании семьи. Мавлуда изгатавливает домашние колбасы по рецемтам своей бабушки, которая учила Мавлюду в детстве и продаёт в центральном рынке района.Также Мавлуда изгатавливает колбасы на заказ. Хотя этот вид торговли не прибыльная, но для содержании семьи хватает и она на это не жалуется. Несмотря на низкий доход Мавлуда с мужем уже выдали дочерей замуж. Мавлуда является молодой бабушкой, которая няньчит и балует своих внуков. Сын Мавлуды учится в ВУЗ-е и ей необходимо  купить компьютер для сына чтобы он мог пользоваться в своей учёбе, а также оплатить  учебу сына. Но у неё недостаточно средств,  несмотря на те средства которые отправляет ей муж. И поэтому поводу Мавлуда обратилась за кредитом в организацию Арванд. Она надеется на поддержку и заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Mavluda is 48 and the mother of four. Her husband is working in Russia. Mavluda is a very thoughtful, kind, and decent woman. She helps her husband to support the family. She makes homemade sausage using a recipe her grandmother taught her when she was young, and sells it at the district's main market. She also makes custom-ordered sausage. Even though this business is not very profitable, it is enough for her family and she has no complaints about it. Despite their small income, Mavluda and her husband have already married off their daughter. Mavluda is a young grandmother who babysits and spoils her grandchildren. Her son is studying at college and she needs to buy a computer for him. She also has to pay for his tuition. But she cannot afford it, despite the money that her husband sends to her. So Mavluda has requested a loan from Arvand. She is counting on their support and expresses her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy a computer and pay for  tuition

loans.name: Buyankhuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Buyankhuu, 42 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their old house on a plot of land. She and her husband have been making interior decoration to entities on contract for about 10 years and have accumulated a vast amount of experience. This year, due to the presidential election, the interior decoration orders are minimal, so they decided to renovate their old house using this spare time. 

She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, they will repair and insulate their old house. As a result, the renovated house will enable the family to reduce their coal consumption and release less pollutants, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials to repair and insulate her old house.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Balide, Aurora, Zamboang del Sur. To make a living, Editha operates a general store, earning 8,000 a month. 

Editha is requesting a loan from GDMPC for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional working inventory.  She joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services.  She plans to expand her business in order to assure the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional working inventory

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo es comerciante, vende artículos de cotillón, vive en casa propia ocupando una habitación en un acabado de adobe y piso de cemento en la zona de Alto San Pedro  de la ciudad de la Paz.
Arturo vende sus productos para cubrir sus gastos de agua, luz, transporte y otros.
El credito lo  requiere para el aumento de su capital; comprará cartulina, pegamento, para elaborar el cotillón  y así mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Arturo es tener un local propio donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Arturo is a salesman who sells party favors.  He lives in his own home, occupying one room with adobe walls and a cement floor.  His house is located in Alto San Pedro, in the city of La Paz.

Arturo sells his products so that he can cover his water, electricity, transportation and other expenses.

Arturo's dream is to own his own premises from which to sell his products.

loans.use: to buy card and glue to make the party favors he sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish bathroom repairs in his shop, purchase a sign, and purchase additional inventory for the store.

loans.name: Alfredo Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Alfredo, tiene 34 años vive con su pareja con la que tienen  un hijo de la edad de 5 años el Sr. Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura,  hace más de 11 años, ellos viven en la comunidad de Forestal Playon  Distante a 60 km. del Torno,  donde tienen su parcela donde siembran sandia, maíz, cítricos y yuca, el crédito que ha solicitado es para la siembra de yuca  y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra Todo lo que ellos siembran lo venden directo del productor al consumidor en el mercado de la zona, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Señor Alfredo is 34 years old and lives with his partner with whom he has a five-year-old child. Alfredo has worked in agriculture for over 11 years. They live in the community of Forestal Playon Distante, 60 km from Torno, where they have a plot of land on which they grow watermelon, corn, citrus fruits and manioc. The loan he has requested is to plant manioc and to cover the costs involved in preparing the ground. Everything that they grow they sell directly from the producer to the consumer in the local market. Alfredo feels happy and grateful with the organization for the support it provides, since this is the only activity that enables him to support his family.

loans.use: to plant manioc and prepare the ground.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна порядочная и добрая женщина. Она образованная женщина и хранительница очага своего дома. Мавзуна замужем за прекрасного человека, который работает кассиром в Микрозаемной организации. Мавзуна на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Мавзуна хочет, чтобы ее дети получили хорошую образованию и стали высококвалифицированными людьми. Дети Мавзуны Мафтуна, Хабибулло и Хадиятулло учатся в лицее. Они успешно учатся и активно участвуют в общественной жизни школы. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы детей в лицее. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavzuna is a respectable and kind woman. She is well-educated and keeper of the hearth of her home. She is married to a wonderful husband who works as a cashier in a microlending institution, and has three children. Mavzuna wants to see her children get a good education and become highly skilled adults. Her children — Maftuna, Habibullo, and Hadiyatullo — go to a boarding school. They are good students and actively participate in the school's social life. Mavzuna is requesting a loan to pay for her children's tuition. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school tuition

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, requiere de un préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol; este le permitirá comprar abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas para realizar el cultivo.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios en el momento oportuno, las utilidades han incrementado, ya que ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
José needs a loan because he needs more working capital to continue investing in his corn and bean crops.  This loan will allow him to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides.

José's previous loan helped him to buy farming inputs when he needed them.  His profits have increased and he has managed to support his children's education.  His financial situation and his family situation have both improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana,  se le presenta la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar las ganancias, ya que logro obtener una buena cosecha; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Juana needs more working capital to continue investing in her crops.  She is requesting a new loan which will allow her to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides.

Juana's previous loan helped her to increase her profits as she enjoyed a good harvest.  Her financial situation and her family situation have both improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en: Jeremias is from La Victoria Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married and has three children. He is 34 years old. Jeremias used his last loan to purchase additional used shoes ("okay-okay") to sell. His business is successful, and he is taking a new loan in the amount of 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more used shoes to sell. In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes ("okay-okay") to sell.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix, es soltero y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en una casa alquilada ocupando solo dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Calacoto de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día como administrador en una empresa privada ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación, alquiler y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para refacción del departamento donde actualmente vive ya que tiene mucha humedad y eso le afecta en su salud.
El sueño de Felix es mejorar sus ingresos para tener su casa propia y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida para tener mas comodidad y seguridad para su hijo.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Felix is single and has a school-aged child. He lives in  a rented house in just two rooms. The house is located in the area of Calacoto in the city of La Paz. He currently works for over eight hours a day as a director of a private company, since with his earnings he has to cover food and education expenses, rental and basic service fees.

He requires the loan to refurbish the apartment in which he is living at the moment, since it is very damp and that affects his health. Felix's dream is to boost his income so that he can have his own home and in this way improve his quality of life so things are more comfortable and safe for his child.

This is the first time he is requesting a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to refurbish the apartment in which he lives, since it is very damp.

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
Sri Cendana group now has 9 members and a new head, Ni Ketut. With a loan of 10 million Rupiahs (IDR), they will buy piglets and feed. Ni Ketut lives with her husband who works as a farmer. She has 2 children and they are married.

She used the loans to buy 2 superior quality piglets and feed. The pigs will be kept for 6 months for fattening. To keep down costs in feed, she is feeding it a mixture between traditional feed and artificial feed mill that does not reduce the quality of feed. Ni Ketut expects growth in the pig will be good and that she will sell them at a high price. She has a dream to renovate her house from the profit of raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy 2 superior quality piglets and buy feed

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 29 years old. She has two sons who are in primary school. Her husband and she are carpenters. He earns about 10,000,000 Dong (VND) and Loan earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for five years. Her family's total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work are the lack of capital to run her carpentry workshop and lacking the knowledge to raise her children well. Her dream is her children can grow up well and have good jobs in the future. This loan is one of steps helps her reaching to this dream. She can invest in her carpentry workshop to gain earnings. Loan is a hardworking woman and has a passion for business.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan, she borrowed 8,282,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more wood for her business. She always wants to expand her business and raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her business

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis, es soltero y no tiene hijos vive en la casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja en una empresa privada como ingeniero civil, por más de diez horas al dia ya que debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material construcción (cemento, ladrillos, fierro, arena) ya que actualmente  realiza la construcción de un  departamento en la casa de sus padres, ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Jose Luis, es mejorar sus ingresos para terminar con la construcción de su vivienda para tener más comodidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is single and doesn't have any children.  He lives in his parents' house in Chijini, in the city of La Paz.

Jose Luis currently works for a private company as a civil engineer.  He works more than ten hours a day as he needs to cover the cost of his food and basic services.  He needs this loan to buy building supplies (cement, bricks, iron and sand).  He is currently building an apartment within his parents' home as he would like to improve his quality of life.

Jose Luis' dream is to improve his income so that he can finish building his home and live more comfortably.  This is the first time that he has requested a loan from Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand to continue building an apartment in his parents' house

loans.name: Jagadamba Group

texts.en:
Sujeshta is 45 years old and lives in Tetelkhunti village of Balangir district, Odisha, India. The lady standing second from right with raised hand in the photograph is Sujeshta. She lives with her husband and three sons of twenty-six, twenty and thirteen years of age. She belongs to a poor family. 

Sujeshta has been running an ice cream making and vending business with salt, biscuits and detergent powder retailing for the last 15 years. Her husband and two sons manage the business. Her husband goes to a wholesale market 300 kms away once a month to bring the stock of salt, detergent powder and ingredients for ice-cream. 

From the above business Sujeshta earns approximately 7000 INR which is not sufficient for her to manage her household expenses along with investment for her business. To expand her business Sujeshta formed a group named Jagadamba, taking in other five women from her village to take loans from Mahashakti Foundation. From the present loan she has planned to purchase raw ingredients for her ice-cream business and bulk amounts of salt, biscuits and detergent for resale. She hopes this will help her to increase her income for materializing her dreams of construction of a house and marriage of her sons.

The other borrowers of the group are Tilottama, Nalini, Hemalata, Saebani and Tapaswini with a general store, puffed rice, procurement of pulses (lentils, etc.) and puffed rice selling businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing raw ingredients for her ice-cream business and bulk amounts of salt, biscuits and detergent

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and has two children. She lives in Laperian, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. 

Maria owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of used shoes to earn a living. She has been in this business for seven years. Each month, she earns 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2010, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She hopes to improve her business to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings in her shoe stall.

loans.name: Bublen Group

texts.en:
Tapaswini, aged 40 years, is a very active lady from a rural village called Tetelkhunti of Balangir district in Odisha, India. Tetelkhunti village is remotely located and out of reach of basic facilities. Tapaswini leaves with her husband and one son of seventeen years. Tapaswini has been running a bicycle repair business for the last twenty years with the help of her husband. Her husband also sells bicycle spare parts to his clients at reasonable rates. He has very good technical skills in his occupation and his customers from 10 or12 nearby villages trust him very much. He brings cycle spare parts thrice in a month from the nearby town Titilagarh, which is 15 kms. away from the village. 

From the present business Tapaswini earns 200 INR per day, which is hand to mouth for her. Due to this situation, till now she has not been able to construct a good house for her family.  So these poor circumstances compel Tapaswini to search for a credit source for the expansion of her business. To fulfill her dream, In the year 2013 Tapaswini, along with other four poor women from her village, formed a Joint Liability Group named Bublen. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Mahashakti Foundation for further expansion of her husband’s business. She will use the loan to buy bicycle repair tools and spare parts in larger quantities, which will help her provide better services to her clients and increase her profits. Tapaswini hopes to build a permanent cycle repairing cabin in her village.

The other four members of the group are Sunanda, Saraswati & Basanti with puffed rice businesses  and Rebati with a tailoring center.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing bicycle repair tools and spare parts

loans.name: Blanca Delia

texts.es:
Doña Blanca es una mujer de 30 años de edad en un estado civil casado y madre de 3 hijos con un grado de educación secundaria completa. Ella es agricultora hace mucho tiempo y junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo y siembra de café mismo que es comercializado en los alrededores de la zona donde ella habita, con los diferentes compradores, intermediarios y en el mercado local. Ella aprendió dicha actividad en compañía de su esposo siendo los únicos 2 involucrados en todas las actividades que realizan en el campo como ser: riego, mantenimiento, limpieza entre otros.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos entre otros para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café ya que con ello espera que su cosecha mejore.

Sus metas para el futuro son ampliar sus tierras, sembrar una variedad de granos que ayuden al crecimiento de su negocio, a mejorar los ingresos para su familia y sobre todo a generar ingresos para darles a sus hijos una mejor educación, y enviarlos a la universidad.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of three children.  She completed her secondary education.  Blanca has been a farmer for a long time and, together with her husband, she grows coffee which she sells in surrounding areas to different buyers and middlemen, and also in the local market.  Blanca learned this business alongside her husband and they are the only two people who carry out all the tasks on their land including irrigation, maintenance, weeding, etc.  

Blanca is requesting help to buy fertilizers, manure and other products she needs to maintain her coffee crops and improve her harvest.  Her future goals are to expand the area of land on which she grows her crops and to sow a variety of grains so that she can grow her business.  She hopes to improve her income for her family's sake and, above all, to make enough income to provide her children with a better education and send them to university.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for her coffee crops

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Originally from Monterrey, Mexico, Juan resides in San Antonio, Texas and owns Morsa Transportation, LLC, a 9-year-old, family-owned trucking business.

With 10 years of experience, one full-time and one part-time employee, Juan, 36, offers services such as transporting items up to 10,000 pounds to residents in Texas and Oklahoma either the same, or next day. To further expand his business, Juan came to Accion Texas Inc. for a $5,450 loan. 

His loan will help meet the demand of his clients. Juan said. Without the loan, “I would not be able to offer hot-shot services.” Find out more about Morsa Transportation on Juan’s website: www.morsatransportation.com/.

loans.use: to offer more specialty transport services

loans.name: Binapani Group

texts.en:
Lalita, the lady standing second from right with raised hand in the photograph, is a 36-year-old housewife. She belongs to a poor family of "scheduled caste, below poverty line". She is very active and energetic. She lives with her husband and two sons of six and one year old in Titilagarh town of Balangir district in Odisha, India. 

For the last five years she has been running a general grocery shop with the help of her husband. She works very hard to meet their family's needs. She needs additional capital for the growth of her business, as her demand from clients is increasing day by day. Therefore Lalita has requested a loan from Mahashakti Foundation, forming a Joint Liability group with three other women of her locality named Binapani. She will purchase a variety of products including flour, pulses, detergents, oils, etc. to keep up with the increased demand of clients. 

Lalita and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family. Lalita hopes to give better education to her sons from her additional income. 

The other three members of the group are Nilendri, Kumari and Kunti,running a cycle repair mart, an auto-rickshaw business and a fabrication center.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of flour, pulses (lentils), detergents, oils, etc.

loans.name: Kassipin

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 6 enfants, Kassipin est âgée de 51 ans et vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans la  ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons sociales, elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer les études primaires, raison pour laquelle elle s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge auprès de sa mère. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se lancer dans cette activité d’achat et de vente d’articles divers. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle  en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y a plus de 7 ans.  Après  des prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe)  tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 6ème prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été correctement remboursé. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des différentes sortes d’ustensiles et de tasses en provenance de Ghana et Togo, elle effectue sa vente en domicile à une clientèle  de femmes en générale au comptant ou à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Married, and the mother of six children, Kassipin is 51 years old and lives with her ​​husband and children in the city of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region). For social reasons, Kassipin did not have the chance to continue her primary education. For this reason, she became interested in income-generating activities with her mother at a young age. After attempting several businesses without success, she finally started her current business of buying and selling various merchandise.

To satisfy her customers' demand and expand her business, Kassipin decided seven years ago to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. With her solidarity loans (i.e. loans as part of a group) all fully repaid, Kassipin is currently on her sixth individual loan, with her prior loans repaid in full. With this loan, Kassipin plans to purchase an assortment of utensils and cups from Ghana and Togo. She sells her merchandise from her home for cash or on credit to a clientele composed mainly of women.

Kassipin hopes to earn an average monthly income of 75,000 FCFA. She plans to use the money she earns to repay her loan from Soro, and to help pay for the family's household expenses. The remainder Kassipin will invest into further income generating activities.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of utensils and cups for resale.

loans.name: Ngu

texts.en:
Ngu is 54 years old, married, and has two adult children. Her husband is a carpenter. He earns about 5,000,000 VND a month. Ngu is a carpenter and earns about 4,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND a month. 

Ngu is requesting a loan from SEDA for 10,080,000 VND, which she will use to buy more wood for her business. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to invest in her business. This loan  will help her invest in her carpentry workshop. She will use the profits to expand her carpentry workshop and save money for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for her business.

loans.name: Izamara Auxiliadora

texts.es: Izamara, es una jovencita de 21 años de edad estudia la carrera de Banca y Finanzas, en la actualidad no está trabajando pero está poniendo todo su empeño en sus estudios que cursa gracias a una media beca. Ella está solicitando apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación, ya que sus condiciones económicas no le permiten hacer este gran gasto de un solo pago, le interesa mucho su profesión porque así podrá tener un empleo y poder aportar de sus ingresos en la familia.
texts.en:
Izamara is a young woman. She is 21 and studies Banking and Financing. She is not currently working but she studies hard. She can study thanks to a scholarship that covers half of her studies.

Izamara is requesting financial support to pay for a course since she is not able to pay for it at the moment. She believes that her title will help her get a job and contribute with some income to her family’s support, and this is why she thinks her studies are important.

loans.use: to pay for a course to receive her degree.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
After only being open for two months, Antonio was looking at losing his business because he could not meet the demand of his clients and feared losing them to competitors. Battling the rising cost of gas, Antonio found himself facing a dead end, until he went to Accion Texas Inc.

Once he applied and was approved for a $5,450 loan, Antonio was able to take on more truck loads - therefore increasing the longevity of his business and being able to continue working.

With more than five years of experience in the transportation industry, Antonio knows the ins-and-outs of getting the job done. He says his customer service is what keeps his clients doing business with him instead of other businesses.

loans.use: to take on more truck loads and stay in business

loans.name: Los Triunfadores Anexo De Veloy Group

texts.es:
Rolando pertenece  al grupo “los Triunfadores - Anexo Veloy” está conformado por personas muy emprendedoras y luchadores dedicadas a diversas actividades  para sacar cada uno a sus familias adelanta a sus familias.
Rolando es muy conocido  en el sector que vive ya que el arte que lleva en sus manos, es su principal fuente de ingresos.
El se dedica a los bordados de prendas tradicionales de está región del Perú, con este trabajo sustenta a su familia a demás con sus esposa se dedican a la ganadería.
Rolando tiene 5 hijos, sólo 2 de ellos están a su cargo, el se siente muy orgullosos por que valoran sus trabajo y además por que es un trabajo que une a su familia ya que su esposa y sus hijos en sus tiempos libres lo apoyan.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de hilos de diversos colores ya que cuenta con muchos pedidos de esta prenda típica. 
Rolando está alegre y agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo obtenido. Rolando viste un polo color blanco y es el primero de la izquierda.
texts.en:
Rolando belongs to the Los Triunfadores –Anexo Veloy group.  It is comprised of very enterprising and tenacious people who devote themselves to diverse business activities in order to get each one of their families ahead.

Rolando is very well-known for his art in the area where he lives.  It is his main source of income.  He embroiders clothing that is traditional in this part of Peru.  With this work he supports his family.  Additionally, his wife works with livestock.  Rolando has five children; only two of them are under his care.  He is very proud because they value his work and because it is work that unifies his family.  His wife and children help him in their free time.

He will use the loan to buy diverse colors of thread because he has many orders for typical clothing.

Rolando is happy and grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan he received.  Rolando is wearing a white shirt and he is the first one on the left.

loans.use: to buy diverse colors of thread.

loans.name: Ernestina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ernestina, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque desde la primera vez que Kiva le proporciono el crédito ha mejorado su entorno financiero y familiar; este le permitirá comprar  maíz, harina, aceite, manteca, azúcar, sal, entre otros productos que necesita para la elaboración de quesadillas  para vender y asimismo para comprar dos cerdos medianos para crecerlos y luego comercializarlos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir cerdos, los cuales posteriormente los vendió y esto mismo le ha generado ganancias para ir cancelando el crédito, también ha logrado brindarle alimentación diaria a su familia y los hijos continúan estudiando, la familia se mantiene el mismo grupo pero si, se han optimizado las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ernestina would like a new loan because since the first time that Kiva offered her a loan, her finances and family life have improved.  This allows her to buy corn, flour, oil, butter, sugar and salt among other products that she needs to make quesadillas and sell them, and also buy two medium-sized pigs to raise them and then sell them.

The previous loan helped her to acquire pigs, which she later sold and this alone has generated earnings to pay back the loan.  She has also been able to offer daily meals to her family and her children continue to study.  The family is in the same group, but has optimized their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, oil, butter, sugar, salt, and two medium-sized pigs

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 61 years old and has four children. She lives in San Jose, Aurora, Zamboang del Sur. She owns a farm, planting and harvesting rice. 

She is requesting a loan from GDMPC for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer. She hopes to have an abundant harvest to generate more income for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina received her real-estate license in January 2013 and decided to go into business for herself, helping others to purchase or sell homes. Though she recently passed the exam to become a real estate saleswoman, Regina plans to hire two part-time employees next year. 

After learning about Accion Texas Inc. from Business Investment Growth (BIG) in Austin, a central Texas single-source entrepreneurial education center tailored to helping small businesses successfully grow, Regina applied for a loan to market her business. With her loan, Regina will purchase real estate signs, a lock box to store the keys of the homes she’s selling, and provide additional training to be successful in her trade. 

The 48-year-old mother of three says if she hadn’t received the Accion loan, the start of her business would have been delayed. She describes what she offers as education that will help her clients successfully purchase or sell their home.

She serves Austin and surrounding counties, including Buda, Cedar Park, Georgetown, Leander, Round Rock and Pflugerville.  About looking for a home Regina says, “it’s not the same everywhere, so you need someone you can trust for up-to-date information.”

loans.use: to purchase real estate signs, a lock box to store the keys of the homes she’s selling, and provide additional training to be successful in her trade.

loans.name: Elinor

texts.en:
Elinor is 48 years old, married, and has children. She is from the village of Guinagabian in the province of Isabela. Elinor is engaged in making pots, which she has been doing for 15 years. 

Elinor is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to to purchase clay and wood for her business.  The additional income will sustain the needs of her family. Elinor strives to give a quality education to her children. She hopes that someday she can build another business.

loans.use: to purchase clay and wood for her business

loans.name: Bayarkhurel

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarkhurel, 38 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their brick house on a small plot of land. Bayarkhurel is an interior decorator by trade and he used to work at a building company. However, he and his wife have been running a pub since 2011 and have now secured many permanent customers. In addition, they have hired two people - a waitress and a cashier.  

The house that the family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some interior and exterior repair. Thus, Bayarkhurel is requesting a loan of 6,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase building and insulation materials such as cement, wallpaper, fiberglass, foam and metal. Using those materials and his professional skills, he will be able to repair and insulate his old brick house, restoring it to its original state. The renovated house will have a positive effect on the environment as the family will burn less coal, and hence release less pollutants into the atmosphere. Bayakhurel is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo con quien vive en su casa propia.Sonia se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura cultivando distintas plantas como cacao y café orgánico en un terreno agrícola de 2 hectáreas, el cual compró con ayuda de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.
Desde niña vivía junto a sus padres quienes también se dedicaban a la agricultura y eso le sirvió para aprender el oficio de la producción y a mantener las distintas plantaciones en buen estado esperando obtener  ganancias para beneficio de su familia.Suele trabajar con ayuda de jornaleros a quienes contrata para tareas colectivas como el retiro de maleza y cosecha, además también recibe el apoyo de su esposo cuando no se encuentra realizando trabajos de construcción. Para mejorar la calidad de sus frutos usa abono orgánico.
Uno de sus principales deseos es comprar un vehiculo para transportar sus frutos desde sus terrenos hasta su localidad para así venderlos sin problemas.Este es el primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.En esta ocasión desea contra con 3,000 nuevos soles para adquirir un terreno de cultivo y así sembrar plantas de cacao orgánico y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 36 years of age. She is married and has a son. They live together in a house that she owns.

Sonia has worked in agriculture for 10 years, cultivating different crops such as cacao and organic coffee in a plot of agricultural land that covers 2 hectares. She bought the land with the help of her husband who works as a mason. 

As a young girl she lived with her parents who also worked in agriculture. This gave her the chance to learn how to produce and maintain different plantations in good condition as a way to earn an income to benefit her family. She usually works with the help of day labourers, whom she contracts for group tasks such as weeding and harvesting. Her husband also helps her when he is not working on a construction job. To improve the quality of her harvests she uses organic fertilizer. One of her dreams is to buy a vehicle to easily transport her harvests from the fields to the place where she sells them.

This it is her first loan with Kiva. She is very thankful for the financial support that she is receiving. It will allow her to move forward. On this occasion she is requesting 3000 Peruvian Soles to acquire a new plot of land to cultivate organic cacao in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for agriculture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seafood wholesale

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: El Sr. Cecilio   tiene 65 años tiene tres hijos de las edades de 30, 23 y 19 años, El Sr. Cecilio  se dedica  a la   fabricación de canaletas para distintas construcciones, tiene su taller en la zona  Pampahasi de la  ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, El Sr. Cecilio   va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material como laminas de aluminio y herramientas para la fabricación de canaletas  y otros materiales que necesita, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Cecilio   va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de material, El Sr. Cecilio   es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada,  su deseo es poder producir en mayor cantidad y ofrecer sus productos a distintos construcciones   y ferias de los distintos barrios y por qué no también a  nivel Nacional.
texts.en:
Cecilio, 65, has three children, ages 30, 23, and 19.  Cecilio earns a living making gutters for various structures.  His shop is in the Pampahasi area of the city of La Paz.

This is Cecilio's first loan cycle with the institution.  He's going to use the loan to buy material such as aluminum sheets and tools to make gutters and other materials he needs.  He's requesting this loan to continue improving in his business.  Cecilio's going to use his profits to continue buying a variety of materials.

Cecilio's a very hardworking person and he's happy about this opportunity.  He wants to be able to produce more and offer his products in various buildings and fairs in different neighborhoods and even at the national level.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old, single, and has two children. She lives in Gapasan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She owns a rice farm. 

Jocelyn is requesting a loan from GDMPC for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to finance the costs of land preparation for rice production. She hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to finance the costs of land preparation for rice production

loans.name: Luz De Maria

texts.es: Doña luz de 43 años de edad vive en casa de su abuela con su compañero de vida, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años,  tienen mucha clientela pues tiene la tienda bien surtida con golosinas, gaseosas, aceite, refrescos, etc. con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda a cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, doña luz esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: granos básicos, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, azúcar, verdura, útiles escolares, etc. para poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Luz is 43 years old.  She lives in her grandmother’s home with her life companion.  For the past several years, she has had a store set up at her residence. She has many customers because the store is well-stocked with candy, soda, oil, soft drinks, and other products.  The profits she earns help her to pay some of the household expenses.  Luz is requesting the loan to purchase more merchandise such as basic grains, oil, candy, soft drinks, sugar, vegetables, school supplies, and other items to earn more profits and provide her family with financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as basic grains, oil, candy, soft drinks, sugar, vegetables, school supplies.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol sus productos los vende en los comercios de compra-venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gatos de su hogar, don Manuel esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con sus cultivos y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Manuel has worked in agriculture for several years and his main crops are corn and beans.  He sells his products to firms that buy and sell basic grains and uses the profits he earns to cover some of his household expenses.

Manuel is asking for a loan to buy supplies like fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicide, etc. and to make improvements to the field shown in the photo so he can continue planting and give his family better quality of life with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es:
María,  requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de incrementar y hace más grande su granja para obtener mayores ingresos; este le permitirá comprar madera y lamina para construir una galera para albergar pollos de engorde.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar las utilidades; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
María needs a new loan to expand and enlarge her farm to earn more income.  This will allow her to buy wood and corrugated metal sheets to build a pen for her chickens.

The previous loan helped her increase her profits.  Her economic situation has improved and her family circumstances are stable.

loans.use: to buy wood and corrugated metal sheets for a chicken pen

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 63 años de edad, es una mujer admirable. Es viuda hace 22 años y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia.A pesar de criar sola a sus hijos, ella mantiene la misma fortaleza de siempre.Juana se dedico a la venta de verduras , su trabajo es arduó, pues tiene que viajar a diferentes lugares y en días estratégicos, ya que las ventas lo realiza en las distintas ferias , además cuenta que tiene un lugar propio en el mercado de su ciudad donde también vende sus productos. Por otro lado recibe el apoyo de su último hijo quien trabaja como albañil construyendo casaa. Ahora desea abrir un negocio con el que pueda mantenerse sin preocupaciones por el resto de su vida. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y está contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Juana; invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de verduras al por mayor.
texts.en:
Juana, 63, is an admirable woman.  She’s been a widow for 22 years and has three children; only one of them still lives with her in her own house.  Despite raising her children alone, she’s still as strong as ever.  

Juana went into selling vegetables.  Her work is demanding because she must travel to different places on strategic days because her sales take place in various street markets.  She also relates that she has a place of her own in the city market where she also sells her products.  On the other hand, her youngest son who works in construction building houses gives her some support.

She’d like to open a business now that will make it possible for her to support herself worry-free for the rest of her life.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she’s happy with the financial support she’ll get to continue forward.  She will use the 1,500 soles to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su madre, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y poder seguir ayudando a su madre en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
This client lives with her mother.  She’s well-known in the zone where she lives because of her humility and dedication to work.  She’s never given into defeat and has always overcome her difficulties.  

With effort and dedication she owns a store where she sells basic staples like basic grains, milk, eggs and rice, among others.  She’s very dedicated to her work and very service oriented during sales which is why she has customers that seek her out and prefer her for her products.

She needs to stock the store a little better because of increased demand but does not have capital to do so which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy more products like basic grains, instant products, snacks, beverages, etc.  She trusts in God that the requested help will soon be granted so she can continue helping her mother with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Karla Elizabeth

texts.es: Karla de 31 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa alquilada, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, shampoo, lociones, etc. desde hace varios años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Karla esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y poder surtir mas su negocio para obtener mas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Karla is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their 2 children in a rented house. For various years she has dedicated her time to selling perfumes, creams, deoderants, shampoo, lotions, etc. With the earnings she obtains from her sales, and with her husband's help, they manage to cover their household expenses.

Karla is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more merchandise at wholesale to stock her business, in order to obtain more earnings and offer her family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, lotions, creams, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: La Sra. Wilma tiene 47 años sigue con la misma actividad de la Venta de comida, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas,   en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la siembra de perejil y para el preparado de la tierra  ella tiene su parcela ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro, donde ella vive también, se dedica a ambas actividades  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Wilma is 47 and continues to operate her business selling food after using her previous loan to purchase supplies for food preparation. Wilma is now requesting a loan for parsley planting and soil preparation in the plot of land by her home in the town of San Pedro. Wilma both cultivates this land and sells food. She's happy and grateful for the opportunity that loans provide her to grow her business.

loans.use: to plant parsley and prepare the soil

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: Doña María de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia, se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Doña María es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir a precios muy accesibles. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, botones, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 58 years old and she lives in her own home.  She is engaged in dressmaking and sells clothing.  Her business is located in her home.  María is an incredible woman and a very good example as she is very hardworking, responsible, and positive.  In addition, many people give her good personal and professional references.  She makes a variety of clothing at very affordable prices.  She has been engaged in this activity for many years so she already has a lot of experience and, above all, she has regular customers that prefer her more each day.  She has decided to request this loan from Integral to invest in her small business and purchase needed supplies such as fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other items to make a variety of clothing.  She does all this with the goal of providing better service to her customers so that they are motivated to continue requesting her services and, in this way, increase her sales and income.  She hopes to achieve her goal and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Juana Dina

texts.es: Doña Juana de 65 años de edad se dedica a la venta de medicamentos vende de forma ambulante en las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tienen mucha clientela pues son productos de buena calidad con las ganancias que obtienen logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su nieto de 18 años quien estudia actualmente. Doña Juana esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas medicamentos por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener una mejor vida con su nieto.
texts.en: Juana, 65, sells medications as a street vendor in neighborhoods close to her house. She has many customers because her products are high quality. She is able to pay household expenses with the income she earns. She lives in her own house with her 18-year-old grandson, who is a student. Juana has applied for a loan to buy wholesale medications so that she can keep her business going, as it is her only work, and be able to have a better life with her grandson.

loans.use: to buy wholesale medications.

loans.name: Loi

texts.en:
Loi is 31 years old; she has two children. One is studying at primary school while the other is still learning in kindergarten. Her husband earns a living as a carpenter; he earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

Loi has been renting dishes, tables, and chairs for small events for the past seven years.  She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month, and her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

Loi’s challenges in life and work are the lack of capital to buy more dishes, tables, and chairs to rent , and investing in her husband's carpentry workshop. She also strives to raise her children, as well. Her dream is for her children to grow up well and be successful in business. 

This loan is one of the steps to help her reach these dreams.  She can invest in her business to gain earnings, and save the profit for her children’s education. Loi is a hardworking and passionate business woman. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In her last loan cycle, she was loaned 8,288,000 VND. 

In this loan cycle, Loi would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy more dishes, tables, and chairs to rent.

loans.use: to buy more dishes, tables, and chairs to rent.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó su negocio hace varios años atrás vendiendo ropa ya que se quedo sin empleo. Poco a poco siguió en sus ventas hasta tener una cartera de clientes. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 09:00am hasta las 21:00pm todos los días vendiendo pantalones, blusas, camisetas etc. 

El tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que quiere seguir trabajando y vendiendo ropa, ya que ahora la ropa la comprar económica y la vende a un precio razonable a la clientela. La dificultad que tiene en su negocio es su salud ya que es (pvvs, persona viviendo con vih sida). 

Quiere que su negocio crezca por eso quiere comprar mas mercadería como ropa de mujer y hombre para vender. Y así tener un capital suficiente para tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  He started his business selling clothes years ago when he became unemployed.  He continued with his sales and gradually attained a regular clientele.  He currently works from 9am until 9pm every day selling pants, blouses, t-shirts, etc.

He has many hopes for his business because he wants to continue working and selling clothes since he now buys clothes at reduced price and resells it at a reasonable price to his customers.  The difficulty he has with his business is his health since he’s PVVS (person living with HIV/AIDS).  He wants his business to grow which is why he wants to buy more women’s and men’s clothes to sell so that he can have enough capital to have a store of his own.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothes.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is 31, and is married to 31-year-old Kasmawati. After five years of marriage, and with the growing needs of his family, Muhammad decided to start a drinking water refill business. 

To grow his business, Muhammad is planning on increasing his capacity of water refills, and add additional stock such as instant noodles, cooking oil, snacks, and cigarettes. 

To do this, he has asked for a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase more water refills and additional stock such as instant noodles, cooking oil, snacks, and cigarettes

loans.name: Rossemary Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Rossemary tiene 23 años, se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos como gel para el cabello ya sea para niños y mayores,  ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Alto Llojeta donde ofrece sus productos por mayor y menor,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rossemary va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de gel por mayor  y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Rossemary va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Rossemary es una persona joven y muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Rossemary, 23, works selling cosmetics like hair gel for adults and children.  She sells her products in a sales stand located in the Alto Llojeta zone; she sells both at wholesale and retail.  

This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Rossemary will use it to buy gel at wholesale to provide variety of products to her clientele and increase her profits.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  

Rossemary will use profits to continue buying a variety of beauty products.  Rossemary is a young, very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity being given her by means of the granted loan.

loans.use: to buy hair gel.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con sus padres en casa alquilada, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 3 años donde vende sopas, azúcar, café, golosinas, etc. tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora, amable, responsable y honesta, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de la casa, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería como: granos básicos, aceites, salsas de tomates, refrescos, gaseosas, sopas, azúcar, etc. para surtir su negocio y obtener mas ganancias para seguir ayudando a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: The borrower lives with her parents in a rented home. She has had a small store for three years where she sells soups, sugar, coffee, sodas, etc. She has many customers because she is a very hardworking, friendly, responsible, and honest person. With the revenues she earns from her sales, she helps with household expenses. The borrower is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more merchandise such as basic grains, oils, tomato sauces, beverages, sodas, soups, sugar, etc. in order to stock up her business and generate more revenues in order to continue helping her parents with household expenses.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, oils, tomato sauce, beverages, sodas, soups, sugar, etc.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es: María Rosa, tiene la edad de 60 años, es soltera, y no tiene hijos. Ella quiere  comprar pollos y alimento.   Tiene varios años que se dedica a la actividad de granja avícola y quiere crecer y también desea que su proyecto sea muy productivo. Ella cuida a su padre que es una persona mayor. Es el segundo préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su familia una mejora calidad de vida  y poder  enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
María Rosa, 60, is single and has no children. She wants to buy chicks and feed.  She’s been a poultry farmer for many years and she wants to grow and also wants her project to be productive.  She cares for her father who is a senior citizen.  

This is her second Fudecosur loan.  She’s had no other loans from state banks or cooperatives and Fudecosur offered the best loan terms and the interest rate is much lower.  She also wants to provide better quality of life for her family and to be able to face life more easily.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en la venta de pupusas y en la tienda; este le ayudara a comprar quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, repollo, tomates, entre otros productos necesarios para la elaboración de alimentos.
El crédito anterior le permitió fortalecer el negocio, aumentar sus ganancias y con estas ha apoyado a su familia con los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Marta needs to apply for another loan in order to continue investing in the sales of her store and 'pupusa' [stuffed corn tortilla] shop. The loan will help her to buy soft cheese, fried pork rind, oil, cabbage, tomatoes, and other products needed for preparing foods. 

The previous loan helped her to strengthen her business, increase her profits, and thus she has been able to support her family with the household expenses. The economic conditions and circumstances of the family have improved.

loans.use: to buy soft cheese, fried pork rind, oil, cabbage, tomatoes, and more.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es: Narcisa, de 57 años de edad , es una mujer amable. Vive en compañía de su esposo Demetrio con quien tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia.Desde hace 30 años emprendió el comercio ambulatorio de artefactos.Mayormente trabaja en las ferias regionales y locales; donde aprovecha la aglomeración de personas para poder negociar sus productos como: ollas, planchas, cocinas, radios entre otros. Afirma que gracias a su buena disposición y su experiencia tiene muchos clientes y no le resulta difícil poder mejorar sus ventas. “Ahora deseo comprarme una movilidad para vender mis electrodomésticos, de esa manera me reconocerían mejor”, afirma.Este es el primer préstamo con KIVA, agradece el apoyo de todos ustedes pues emprenderá su negocio con el apoyo financiero financiero necesario para seguir adelante, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Narcisa, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de artefactos como planchas, licuadoras , entre otros.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 57, is a friendly woman.  She lives with her husband Demetrio, with whom she has five children, only two of whom live with her in her own house.

She set up her business selling products on foot 30 years ago.  She works mainly at regional and local fairs where she takes advantage of the number of people to be able to sell pots, irons, stoves, radios, and other products.  She says that thanks to her good aptitude and her experience she has a lot of customers, and improving her sales is not difficult.  "Now I want to buy myself a vehicle to sell my household appliances so I'll be better known," she says.

This is her first Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the help of all of you because she'll set up her business with the necessary financing to get ahead.  She promises to be punctual with her payments.

Narcisa will invest the 1000 soles [PEN] in buying irons, blenders, and other devices.

loans.use: to buy blenders, irons, and other products

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, es una persona honrada y responsable, reconocida en la comunidad. Vive actualmente con sus tres hijos de 13, 18 y 22 años de edad. Paulina, se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias tales como:   crianza de ganado y molino nixtamal propio, el oficio lo realiza desde las 7:00am a 3:00pm  y lo lleva a cabo desde hace 6 años para obtener ingresos económicos.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar una vaca parida, ya que la tiene por el momento esta  horra;  esta inversión le ayudara a estabilizar los gastos del hogar y obtener un negocio más amplio que le genere más oportunidades económicas.
Su sueño es seguir luchando para tener el negocio más rentable que le permita más ingresos económicos para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Paulina is an honest, responsible person who is well-known in the community.  She currently lives with her three children who are 13, 18 and 22 years of age.  Paulina works in agricultural and animal husbandry activities like raising cattle and owning a corn mill.  She works from 7am until 3pm and has been doing so for six years to generate income.

The loan she needs will make it possible for her to buy a pregnant cow because the one she has now has run off.  This investment will help her stabilize household expenses and expand the business so it will generate more economic opportunities.  Her dream is to continue striving to have a more profitable business that will produce higher income to prove better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow.

loans.name: Gastelu

texts.es: Gastelu, de 29 años de edad es un hijo responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres en su casa propia.A pesar de su corta edad, trabaja muy duro para darle un buen futuro a su pequeña hija “Mariela” y a sus padres. Su principal actividad económica es la “agricultura”,en los terrenos de cultivo de sus padres siembra café y maíz ,los cuales cuida con mucho esmero , además cuenta que otra de sus actividades, es la pesca de peces de agua dulce. Cuenta que tres veces a la semana ingresa al río con sus instrumentos de pesca en busca de peces, los cuales vende en le mercado más cercano a su localidad. Su record es pescar 30 kilos al día. Su objetivo es obtener instrumentos industriales y una lancha con lo que pueda alcanzar mayor cantidad de peces y así tener mayores ganancias. Además de ahorrar suficiente dinero para comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Sabe que con constancia lo logrará.Gastelu, invertirá los S/. 3000 soles en la renovación de sus instrumentos de pesca para así mejorar la cantidad de kilos por día.
texts.en:
29-year-old Gastelu is a responsible son who lives together with his parents in his own home.  In spite of his young age, he works very hard to provide his young daughter, Mariela, and his parents with a good future.  His main business is farming and he puts a lot of attention into caring for the coffee and corn crops that he grows on his parents' land.  In addition, Gastelu also catches freshwater fish.  He goes to the river three times a week with his fishing equipment in search of fish which he then sells in the nearest market.  His record for one day is a 30 kilo catch.  Gastelu's aim is to buy industrial equipment and a small boat so that he can catch a larger quantity of fish and make more money.  He would also like to save up enough money to buy his own farmland.  He knows that by persevering he will achieve his aims.

Gastelu will invest the 3,000 soles he has requested in replacing his fishing equipment so that he can improve the number of kilos of fish he catches in a day.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Doña ana de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella tiene un puesto de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es una mujer luchadora que su empeño es dar lo mejor de si misma, para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. Doña ana desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Ana is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She has had a food stall near her home for five years. With the money she makes from her sales, she pays for household expenses. She is a fighting woman whose goal is to give the best to herself so that her family doesn't lack anything they need for their survival. She has the great satisfaction of having steady customers because her stall is in a well-traveled area. Ana wants to grow her stall, that is to say, buy tables, chairs, and more basic materials such as rice, chickens, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc. in order to vary her menu and have a little more money coming in. She does not, however, have enough income for this investment, and that is why she has come to Kiva partner INTEGRAL to request a loan and be able to purchase the aforementioned and so earn more revenues to have better financial stability with her family.

loans.use: purchase tables, chairs, and more basic items such as rice, chickens, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
