Abdoulahat est célibataire et possède comme charges : la  location de sa cantine, son transport et sa nourriture. Il est un habitué des crédits car il est à sa cinquième fois et reconnait que le crédit peut impacter  sur son épargne et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille. 
Comme projet futur, il désire posséder un grand magasin de pièces détachées.
texts.en:
Abdoulahat is a client of the UIMCEC and he sells spare parts.  He has a booth at the market.  He has acquired more than five years of experience in this field, and he works from 9AM until 7PM.

Abdoulahat is single and his expenses are the following: rent for his booth, transportation and food.  He is used to credit as he is on his fifth loan. He acknowledges the positive impact of loans on his savings and the fact that they allow him to improve his family's food conditions.

In the future, he would like to have a large store where he would sell spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Serigne Sam

texts.fr:
Serigne Sam est transporteur de profession, il a une expérience de plus de 2 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant et n’a pratiquement pas de charges.
Serigne Sam vient solliciter un crédit de 200000F CFA pour acheter un tracteur. C’est un novice dans le crédit  et voudrait améliorer son transport et maximiser son profit. Il travaille de 10h à 18h.
Grâce au crédit, il pourra désormais épargner dans le but d’acquérir un autre véhicule.
texts.en:
Serigne Sam is a professional transporter.  He has more than two years of experience in his field of work.  He is single with no children, and he barely has any expenses.  He is requesting a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to buy a tractor.

Serigne Sam is a novice at taking loans.  His goal is to improve his transportation service and to maximize his profit.  He works from 10AM until 6PM.

Thanks to this loan, he will now be able to save some money in order to purchase another vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a tractor.

loans.name: Enih Caroline

texts.en:
This borrower is married with five children and lives in a four-room apartment in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced many difficulties such as her children being sick, death of family members and inadequate finances to run her business successfully and provide three square meals for her family.

With this loan, she will purchase and sell kernel and palm oil in bulk.  She is positive about the business succeeding because she has been in the business for years and has regular customers.  The demand for palm oil is high with low supply in her community.  With her business, the community will have a regular supply of kernel and palm oil and the goods will be sold at moderate prices as she will buy in bulk.  

With the proceeds from this loan, she will expand her business by buying more jugs of palm oil and kernel as well.  She will also pay for her children's education and three meals as well as save some funds to undertake larger investments.  

She prefers GHAPE loans because of convenient repayment intervals, low interest rates and the training offered to members before disbursement of a loan.

loans.use: To buy kernel and palm oil.

loans.name: Sulaiman B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are the teachers of a primary school located in Waterloo, a town in Western Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT (a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone) to apply for a loan of SLL 14,600,000 in order to meet their most immediate and pressing financial challenges. Additionally at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Sulaiman is the featured leader of this group of teachers. A native of Joe Town, the 46-year-old is married to a trader.  The couple have 7 children, 6 of whom are attending primary and secondary school. Sulaiman is going to use his share of this loan to buy building materials such as cement, sticks, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, sticks, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en: Kyalo is a 36-year-old man who is married and has two children.  He describes himself as visionary and ambitious.  He sells second-hand shoes to earn a living and his business is located on the side of the road.  He will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more shoes to sell.  His business challenge is that he is financially constrained.  He will use the profits from the business to pay his children's school fees and also invest in his business.  In the future he hopes to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mui's Group

texts.en:
Mui is 34 years old. She has three children who are in primary and secondary school; her little son is in kindergarten.  Her husband is a builder, and he earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. 

Mui cooks food to sell. Her income is about 3,500,000 VND. She has done this job for seven years. Her family’s total income is 7,500,000 VND per month. 

Mui has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND to breed chickens and dogs, and to grow fruit trees. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy food for chickens and dogs, and to buy ingredients to cook food. She can gain earnings and save the profit so the children grow up well, and to buy household equipment.

Other members who are part in Mui’s group include Xuyen, who is 55 years old, with two children. She sells fish in the market, and she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to develop her work.
 
Xuyen is 53 years old, with two children. She sells groceries, and wants to borrow 7,630,000VND to develop her work.
 
Ly is 48 years old, with two children. She breeds chickens, and wants to borrow 10,246,000 VND to buy food for the chickens.

Lanh is 45 years old, and she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and dogs, and to buy ingredients to cook food.

loans.name: Ruth  Albina

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth tiene 27 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 3 y 8 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de jugos de frutas, gelatinas, crema de leche, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Alto Pampahasi, La Sra. Ruth es una persona muy trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara muebles y si le sobre un saldo  electrodomésticos para su casita, el deseo de La Sra. Ruth es crecer en su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos también mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de sus hijos ya que por ellos se esfuerza para que puedan estudiar y ser personas de bien.
texts.en: Ruth is 27 years old. She has two children, ages three and eight years. She sells fruit juice, jello, and cream at her sales stand in the Alto Pampahasi zone. Ruth is a very hardworking person. With the loan money, she will buy furniture, and if there is some leftover, electric appliances for her little home. Ruth wants to grow her business and improve her revenue stream, as well as improve her quality of life for herself and her children because it is for them that that she works so hard so that they can go to school and be well-off people.

loans.use: purchase furniture for her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is made up of two members, both of whom are women. 

Mary is the general leader and the leader here too. She is 53 years old and has three adult children who are on their own. She has worked, for eight years now, by supplying fish to customers around Teshie and Nungua.

This is her fifth loan with ID-Ghana and she is requesting a loan of 1500 GHS to buy three cartons of fish to supply to her customers. Her customers come home for their goods. Payments are made instantly, which make it more secure and prudent.  

Mary faces challenges in her business; it is competitive as there are other fish sellers around, but her customer-care strategy makes her top them all. She desires for her business to continue increasing its earnings and continue growing. She feels happy and grateful for Kiva's support.

Mary, together with Beatrice, needs a total amount of 1900 GHS to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy three cartons of fish to supply to her customers.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor Manuel es una persona de 40 años de edad, casado, tiene una bella familia integrada por 10 hijos, de los cuales 6 son hombres y 4 mujeres, de todos ellos 8 son menores de edad y están estudiando. Don Victor Manuel su esposa  y sus hijos viven actualmente en Barrio Chosij, municipio de San Antonio Palopó, departamento de Sololá.
El es de oficio comerciante, y actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de verduras, compra la verdura en la comunidad y luego la vende en la capital de Guatemala. Esta actividad la realiza por dos situaciones: uno porque no tiene terreno donde cultivar y por otro lado la compraventa le genera buenas ganancias con las que sostiene a su familia. El es un hombre experimentado en esta actividad porque lleva 18 años realizándola.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para comprar más cebolla porque su demanda ha incrementado.
El sueño más grande de don Victor Manuel es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando hasta graduarse.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel, 40, is married and has a beautiful family made up of ten children, six males and four females.  Eight of them are minors and attend school.  Víctor Manuel, his wife, and their children currently live in Barrio Chosij, in the town of San Antonio Palopó in Sololá Department.

He's a merchant by trade and currently works buying and selling vegetables.  He buys vegetables in his community then sells them in the capital of Guatemala.  He does this work for two reasons: because he doesn't have a plot of land to farm and because buying and selling earns him good profits with which he supports his family.  He's experienced in this work because he has been doing it for 18 years.

He's requesting a loan for 4,000 quetzales [GTQ] to buy more onions because demand has increased.

Víctor Manuel's biggest dream is to improve his family's living conditions and for his children to be able to continue studying until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy onions

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una señorita soltera de 28 años quien vive con sus padres, quienes viven en la Calle Bugdof 2 Aldea San Jorge La Laguna, Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la compraventa de artesanías como joyería de plata, bolsas artesanales y figuras de mármol, lo viene realizando desde hace 12 años. Eligio está actividad porque sus padres le enseñaron esta labor a su corta edad, es por ello que de esta manera obtiene ingresos y ganancias que le permiten aportar al sustento familiar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 que utilizara para la ampliación de su negocio para obtener diversidad de productos en joyería de plata, bolsas artesanales y figuras de mármol. 
Su sueño es construir su casa e independizarse para ser una mujer emprendedora.
texts.en:
Ana is a single woman, 28 years old, who lives with her parents, who live on Calle Bugdof 2 Aldea San Jorge La Laguna, Sololá.

She buys and sells artisan products such as silver jewelry, artisan purses, and marble figurines. She started doing this 12 years ago.

She chose this activity because her parents taught her to work at a young age, and because of this she generates revenue and earnings that allow her to support her family.

She is requesting a loan of Q. 10,000.00 that she will use to grow her business to have diversity of silver jewelry, artisan purses, and marble figurines.

Her dream is to build a home and become independent to be an entrepreneurial woman.

loans.use: grow her artisan business

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 55  años de edad el esta casado y vive en Sololá. Tiene 7 hijos de ellos 5 hombres que trabajan con el y 2 mujeres que realizan oficios domésticos.
Es un hombre amable y sobre todo trabajador, el se dedica a fabricar prendas de vestir típicos que son  utilizados por  las mujeres  indígenas de su región.
Junto a sus hijos se apoyan para realizar esta actividad usando como principal herramienta llamado  (telar) donde coloca el hilo para luego realizar estas prendas. El inicio este trabajo hace 24 años, se dio cuenta que eran pocos los fabricantes de este tipo de  prendas y que mantienen precios buenos en el mercado, es así como  empezó a  obtener buenas ganancias y a mejorar la economía de su familia.
El está solicitando un préstamo de  Q 6,500.00 para la compra de hilo tipo lana para fabricar mayor cantidad de prendas y tener mejores ganancias.
Su sueño es tener un terreno ya que quiere construirles una vivienda a sus hijos como también darles el apoyo necesario en los estudios académicos.
texts.en:
Luis, 55, is married and lives in Sololá.  He has seven children, five men who work with him and two women who do domestic chores.  He's a friendly and hardworking man.

He earns a living making traditional garments worn by indigenous women in his region.  He and his children help each other to do this job, using for their main tool a loom where they place the thread to make these garments.  He started this job 24 years ago.  He realized that there were few people who made this type of garment, which gets a good price in the market, so he started to make good profits and improve his family finances.

He's requesting a loan for 6,500 quetzales [GTQ] to buy wool thread to make a large quantity of garments and have better profits.

His dream is to have a plot of land because he wants to build his children a home and give them the support they need in their academic studies.

loans.use: to buy wool thread to make traditional garments

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: La Sra. Marianela tiene 45 años, casada tiene cuatro hijos,  ella se dedica  a la venta de comida, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Satélite, y también  entrega sus almuerzos a distintos negocios y tiendas,   La Sra. Marianela una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La Sra. Marianela les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara material de construcción para hacer terminar de construir su casa, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal, el deseo de La Sra. Marianela es crecer en su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marianela, 45, is married and has four children.  She makes a living selling food in her stall in the Satélite area.  She also delivers her lunches to various businesses and stores.  Marianela's a very hardworking and dedicated person who little by little is becoming stable and solvent as well as popular, because she's very well known among her customers for her friendly service.

With the money from the loan she'll buy construction materials to finish building her house.

The client says she can grow more with a lot of effort.  This way she'll continue acquiring assets for her family's well-being and her own.

Marianela wants to grow in her business to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 33,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susan hopes to expand her business and be able to give her children a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en: Sadek is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. In 2010, he started working independently as a blacksmith. His job is located next to his home and he has one full-time employee helping him to complete the essential tasks. Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase an iron welding motor and tools needed to carry on with his work properly. He is optimistic about his business prospects and he is certain that with the loan's help his business income will increase In the future, he hopes to make the needed savings to be able to get married and afford the costly expenses.

loans.use: to purchase an iron welding motor and necessary tools.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita. She previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita dreams to have more hogs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional hogs needed for her business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
This is Merly. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Merly hopes that her business will be stable and dreams her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La Sra. Miriam tiene 31 años, tiene dos hijos que tiene las edades de 9 y 5 años que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica desde hace muchos años al servicio de reciclaje de chatarras y envases en el acopio que se encuentran en su misma casa en la zona de Villa Ingavi de donde distribuye a las distintas empresas, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Miriam  va a usar este préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio chatarras y envases de plástico y vidrio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar sus ganancias y por ende su capital, la Sra. Miriam enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia ya que muchas personas al igual que ella se dedican al reciclado de materiales, ella va a utilizar los beneficios compra de mas material para su negocio, el deseo de la Sra. Miriam para su negocio es tener un acopio más grande de reciclaje y poder comprar a minoristas y vender en grandes cantidades a las empresas que se encargan del reciclado de este material.
texts.en:
Miriam is 31 years old and has two school-aged children who are 5 and 9 years old.  She has worked for many years providing recycling services for scrap and containers.  Her supply is located in her home in the Villa Ingavi area, where she distributes to different businesses.  

This loan is her first with this institution.  Miriam will use this loan to purchase merchandise for her scrap and plastic and glass container business.  She wants to increase her income and her capital.  Miriam encounters challenges with her business such as competition, since there are many people who work with recycled materials like she does.  She will use the benefits of the loan to purchase more materials for her business.

Miriam hopes that her business will have a larger area for recycling and be able to purchase at retail and sell in larger quantities to businesses that are responsible for recycling this material.

loans.use: to purchase scrap items at wholesale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma, 42, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Jonald, a driver and they have children. She, with the help of her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually earn income for her everyday expenses.  

Norma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. She also has a direct selling business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Norma dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: United Brothers Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “United Brothers” group. They are a small scale business based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Mohamed. Mohamed is age 37; he was born in Kono, eastern Sierra Leone. Currently, he is residing in Waterloo, together with his wife and 4 children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary schools. Mohamed is an okada driver (motor-bike taxi driver). He has requested a loan in order to buy a new motor-bike.

loans.use: to buy a new motor-bike

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
This is Gregorio. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase more stock of fishnets and scouring pads needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another loan, this time for 15,000 PHP, to buy more stock of fishnets and scouring pads needed in his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Gregorio dreams to expand his business and have his own stall. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of fishnets and scouring pads needed in his business.

loans.name: Manuel Mercedes

texts.es:
Manuel,  se le presenta la necesidad de invertir más en su negocio, por lo que requiere de un nuevo préstamo; este le permitirá comprar una cámara cannon y papel fotografico.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener más clientela; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Manuel wants to invest more in his business so he is requesting a new loan.  This will allow him to purchase a Cannon camera and photo paper.  

His last loan helped him to increase his inventory and obtain more clients.  His financial situation and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to purchase a Cannon camera and photo paper.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Akbar is a kind and hardworking man. He lives with his wife and two sons, Nodirjon and Bobojon, in a house which is in bad condition. His wife is a seamstress and sews very wonderful dresses. 

Akbar’s children want to live in a house which is in good condition, but his income from a taxi service is not enough for it. He must repair all the rooms of his house. He is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy building materials to repair his house. 

In this way, he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing the house.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a divorced mother and has been blessed with five children. She owns a house that has no electricity and piped water. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She previously obtained a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy new computers and video games. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in personal, household, and business expenditures.
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy parts and to cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Alma hopes to have a better shop and good health. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy parts and to cover maintenance costs of her computer shop

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Being a responsible mother and wife, Josephine engages in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband’s income. She is 59 years old and has three grown children. They live happily in a rural community and make their living through farming and raising hogs. Josephine plans to raise more pigs to sell, but, due to inadequate capital, she wants to obtain a loan of 30,000 PHP. If the loan is granted, she intends to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise. Through hard work and strong determination, Josephine believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable someday.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Camal

texts.en:
Camal is 40 years old, married and the father of 3 children.  He is a very hard working man.  He has been raising chickens for 16 years and is very active in the poultry business. He usually buys small chickens, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His wife also helps him in this business, because it’s the only income to their family. From this business his monthly income is 320 AZN.

In Azerbaijan chicken is in very high demand and people use it in everyday dishes like levengi, chicken soup, tabaca, kabab, etc. Camal sells chicken eggs too, because people use chicken eggs every day for breakfast. In one day he sells 50 eggs.

Camal has already taken 3 loans from Aqroinvest in past. With a good loan history he has applied for 4th loan of 1,800 AZN. With this money, he wants to invest it in the business and buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en:
Maftuna is 30 years old and married with two children. Maftuna is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  

She has been running a business of selling milk for many years. Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good-quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Maftuna has two children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is Maftuna's fourth loan. She is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy cows.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Mateo, de 43 años de edad vive junto a Antonia; su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 20 años.“El camino para desarrollarse en la agricultura, es muy difícil”, afirma Mateo, ya que a pesar de tener 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, aún no cuenta con terrenos agrícolas propios. Ya que su principal prioridad durante todo este tiempo, fue mantener a su familia en perfecto estado y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Razón por la cual trabaja en sus tiempos libres como estibador, cargando varios sacos de papa en diferentes camiones para trasportar a los mercados del interior del país. Además de trabajar en diferentes terrenos de cultivo ya que así aprende nuevas técnicas de cultivo para sus sembríos de papa, maíz y alverja. Los cuales vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad más cercana. Este es el quinto crédito con KIVA y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante.Mateo, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Mateo is 43 years old. He lives with his wife Antonia, to whom he has been married for 20 years. They have 4 children together, but only 3 live with them. They bought their house 20 years ago. "The path toward prospering in agriculture is very difficult,” explains Mateo. He has more than 10 years experience in agriculture but he still doesn’t have his own agricultural land. His main goal during this time has been to keep his family in good conditions and provide a good education to his children. This is why, during his free time, he works as a porter, carrying bags of potatoes to different trucks for transport to the markets in the interior of the country. He also works on several different plots of cropland, which is how he learns new cultivation techniques for his potato, corn, and pea crops. He sells them at the wholesale market in the nearest city. This is his fifth loan with Kiva and he feels very grateful for the financial support he has received so that he could continue working. Mateo will use the 3,000.00 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) to buy organic manure to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Apolo

texts.en:
Farming has been Apolo's business involvement. He is 32 years of age, married to an overseas Filipino worker and blessed with one child. 

Currently, he grows rice crops on his two hectares of rice field. Apolo would like to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and insecticides, but his capital is not enough. With regards to this, he is seeking a loan of PHP 30,000. He knows that this loan amount would help him much, especially in providing his crop with proper care and nutrition.

Apolo is looking forward to the approval of his requested loan amount so he can earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and insecticides, needed for his rice field.

loans.name: Cuc's Group

texts.en:
Cuc is 55 years old. She has two children who are married. Her son is an engineer. She cooks food. Her husband helps her do her job. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month.  She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total income is 3,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,938,000 VND to expand her food stall and buy seeds to grow fruit trees. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy fertilizer to plant landscape trees. The profits will help her save money to buy household equipment such as a television, a table and chairs.

Other members who are part in Cuc’s group include the following:
 
Hang is 31 years old. She has two children. She sells chickens in the market. She wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND to develop her work. 
Thu is 38 years old. She has two children. She sells breakfast foods. She wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND to expand her business.
Trang is 31 years old. She has two children. She sells clothes. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to expand her business.
Mai is 35 years old. She has two children. She is a tailor. She wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy cloth.
Dinh is 41 years old. She has two children. She breeds pigs. She wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to plant landscape trees

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi operates a tailoring business, making both men and women suits. In addition, she also operates a café business which also earns her an income. She sells at the market to local neighbors and passersby. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth, sewing threads and needles. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support granted which has helped her boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, sewing threads and needles

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercedita, 40, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Cirilo, and a mother to her children. She keeps herself busy attending to her family and doing business as her way of helping her husband in meeting daily expenses.

Mercedita is in a pillow making business. She cuts scrap materials from textiles, foams and fibers, puts them in a plain pillow case and covers it with a better looking pillow case of various cartoon designs. She makes different kinds and sizes of pillows. She also sells foam. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community. She also has clients in the market that regularly order pillows from her.  She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 32,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more scrap materials that she will use to make pillows. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings would be a big help for the educational expenses of her children. 

Mercedita hopes that her business will continue to grow and help her to send all her children in school. She wants a good life and health for her family. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to listen to the word of God and have a better relationship not only to God but also to her family and community. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship groupis composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build socialcapital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the materials needed for making pillows

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, age 49 and a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to William and a mother to her children. She keeps herself busy tending to her family and doing business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining daily expenses.
Helen’s business involves buying and selling foam of different sizes. Her regular customers are from her neighborhood and local community. She also has clients in the market that regularly order pillows from her. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more foam to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. These earnings would be a big help for the educational expenses of her children.
Helen dreams that her business will continue to grow. She attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to listen to the Word of God and to have a better relationship not only with God but also with her family and community.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more foam to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Alae

texts.en:
Alae is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 25 years old and is the father of a child. Alae works hard to provide his family's income all by himself with the profits he gains through working in his garage. Alae specializes in changing vehicle oils and filters. He established his business in 2010 and has gained good experience in this field. Now Alae has a hired employee and has gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood.

Alae is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 USD, which he will use to pay the annual rent of his garage and to increase his inventory. Alae is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits in order to take better care of his family and provide for their needs.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his garage and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and food for the family.
She operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable business operators.
With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is 32 years old, married and the father of 3 children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and kids in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement .  For the past 8 years he has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. His income of 100 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and he is doing it together with his wife.

He is keeping a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from him. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

He has taken a loan from Aqroinvest before and has a good loan history. This is going to be his 5th loan. This time he requires 1,900 AZN in order to purchase 12 sheep to sell more meat in the summer. He is optimistic about this loan, because in the summer more people consume meat, due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
This is Pelagia. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stock of slippers and sandals for kids, men and women. Her earnings are a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy more inventory of slippers and sandals for kids, men and women. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pelagia dreams to expand her business and have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of slippers and sandals for kids, men and women.

loans.name: María Marisol

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo. vive junto a su mamá de crianza de 80 años de edad, y un joven con capacidades especiales de 20 años de edad, que le dejo a cargo una amiga que se fue a vivir a Estados Unidos.

En su comunidad es la presidente de la asociación de desarrollo comunal (ADESCO), por medio de la cuál han gestionado algunos proyectos;  como elaboración de una casa comunal que funciona como albergue cuando existe el problema de inundaciones, preparación técnica para el cultivo de hortalizas y otras actividades de recreación para los miembros de la comunidad.

Ella Trabaja pequeñas parcelas cultivando Maíz en  áreas de hasta 7000 metros y hortalizas como pipianes en áreas de hasta 3500 metros cuadrados. En época seca realiza riegos por gravedad en sus parcelas con ayuda de motobombas. Estas actividades las realiza desde que tiene 12 años de edad, son cultivos que realizan como tradición familiar.

 Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere  en la ciudad, se estima que hace un recorrido aproximadamente de 25 kilómetros.  Para su comunidad el servicio de transporte es difícil  y los buses llegan y salen de la comunidad 2 veces. Las cosechas las comercializan con comerciantes del mercado municipal de la ciudad, personas con las que poseen la relación comercial de más de 10 años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 1,600 libras de fertilizantes, foliares e insecticidas y el resto para pagos de mano de obra en el cultivo de 3500 metros cuadrados de pipian y 10,500 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz. La actividad agrícola es la única fuente de ingresos que existe en su comunidad y es indispensable para la vida de esta familia.

Su objetivo, es tener la capacidad de producir hortalizas con equipos de riego de mejor eficiencia como el de goteo y tener la capacidad económica para producir hortalizas como el Chile verde.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old. She has a spouse and a son. She lives with her 80 year old foster mother and a 20 year old young special needs man that was left in her care by a friend who went to live in the United States.   

In her community, she is the president of the communal development association (ADESCO), through which she has managed some projects. For example, making a communal house that serves as a shelter whenever there is a flood, technical training for growing vegetables and recreation activities for community members.

She works small land parcels growing corn in areas up to 7,000 meters and vegetables such as pipianes in areas up to 3,500 square meters. This dry season, she is doing irrigation for her parcels with help from motorized pumps. She has been doing these activities since she was 12 years old and these crops are a family tradition.

She acquires her agricultural materials in the city and estimates that she travels about 25 kilometers. For her community, transportation service is difficult and the busses come and go from the community twice. She sells her harvests with merchants from the municipal market, people with whom she has had a business relationship for more than 10 years. 

The loan that she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy 1,600 pounds of fertilizer, foliar applications and insecticides. The rest is to pay for the labor costs to plant 3,500 square meters of pipian and 10,500 square meters of corn. Farming activity is the only source of income that exists in her community and it is indispensable for the life of this family.  

Her goal is to have the capacity to produce vegetables with irrigation equipment with more efficiency such as dripping as well as having the financial capacity to produce vegetables such as the green chile.

loans.use: to buy 1,600  pounds of fertilizer, foliar applications and insecticide. The rest is to pay for labor costs to plant 3,500 square meters of pipian and 10,500 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda dreams to have a grocery store someday. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their life and businesses every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy  grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Venezuela Group

texts.en:
JAMES, who is in his early 50s is married and has three children who are going to school.  He has been doing two types of businesses.  He has been running a retail shop and selling vegetable since 1998. He works from 6.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be JAMES's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase the shop's inventory and planted and sold more vegetables.  He has paid back all his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, covered household expenses and has started building his house.  He will use this loan to restock the missing items in the shop and to buy equipment for improving the farm and plant more vegetables.  His dream is to one day be able to build and finish building his house.

James will share this loan with his loan group "VENEZUELA" with eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to restock the missing items in the shop and to buy equipment for improving on the farm and plant more vegetables.

loans.name: Mwinyihamisi

texts.en:
His business is selling spare parts for motorcycles. Because of it, he's been earning his own income and therefore, helping his family on a daily basis.

This loan will help him to purchase more spare parts for motorcycles such as tires, inner tubes, pistons, rims, etc. He gives thanks for the help he's getting, since that way he'll be able to keep on growing.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak has a cafe in the school of her village. She started it 10 years ago because she needed to work and take care of her 4 children, because her husband has a small salary. 

After organizing her business, the quality of her family's living conditions became better. She takes cares of the business alone. She cooks food and sells it to pupils and teachers at the school. Her working day starts at dawn when she goes to buy the ingredients and continues throughout the day. She has additional income from animal husbandry.

She is asking for a loan of 6000 TJS to buy food products for her café. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food products for her café business.

loans.name: Bintiathuman

texts.en:
Bintiathuman has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a rental house in the near future.

With the loan of 25,000 KES she wants to purchase prawns and dry fish for resale. She joined Yehu because of favorable loan policies.

loans.use: to purchase prawns and dry fish for resale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 42, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Ramie and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arlene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Arlene dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their schooling.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is from Iraq. 35 years old, he is married and has 3 children. Salah is the sole provider for the family.

Salah raises cattle on his small farm. He also prepares dairy products and sells them. This business has been the source of living for this family for decades. In 1999, Salah established his business and gained an excellent reputation thanks to the fresh dairy products that he offers at the market.

Salah is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD. He will use this loan to install a shelter for his cows on the farm. Salah is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may enhance the current financial conditions of the family and provide them with better living standards.

loans.use: to install a shelter for his cows on his farm

loans.name: Hijran

texts.en:
Hijran is a merchant. He has a grocery store where he sells basic foods necessities. He also has an agriculture business from which he sells milk products. 

He is married and has two school-age children under his care. His wife is a housewife and helps him with the agriculture activity. 

Today, the money he is requesting is for the purchase of industrial products for his store. And after some time, he plans to hire an assistant. 

Hijran says that he feels very good about working with VFAC and Kiva because he has seen the growth in himself as a person and in his family. He has a better quality of life thanks to Kiva, which has financed all his requested loans. He invested those loans in his house and his business.

loans.use: To buy industrial products for his store.

loans.name: Zusima

texts.en:
This is Zusima. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more phones and phone accessories for her retail business. Her earnings were a big help with the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more phones and phone accessories for her retail business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zusima hopes to expand and have another branch. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more phones and phone accessories for her retail business.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is 44 years old and the mother of three children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement .She has dedicated 18 years of her life to agriculture. Her husband helps her in this business. She usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 300 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in her family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Tarana also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to her neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase two cattle and one milking cow. This will be her fourth loan.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and one milking cow

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is 31 years old, married and has three children. With her spouse, she manages a furniture-making business as their source of income. They also hire laborers who help them in the business. They make tables and chairs for sofas and kitchens. She wants to improve and make more furniture, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more wood to use in the furniture shop. It will help improve her sales and the income necessary to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy more wood to use in the furniture shop

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is married and lives in Likoni, Mombasa. She has a fish business. She has been buying and selling fish for over three years. She says that with great effort, her business is growing, and she is equipping it little by little. She hopes to be able to have a great place of business. That way she will be able to have better conditions for her customers.

She requested the loan to buy a freezer and a cooler. They will be extremely useful in transporting and conserving her product. She always wants to be able to give her customers fresh, good quality products.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a cooler.

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 30 years old and has a 2 children.

Karrar owns a small shop where he sells fresh fruits and vegetables. He established his business in 2011 and gained his experience through previously working at a similar shop as an employee for several years. Karrar now has 2 hired employees and is well-known in the area thanks to his fresh products.

Karrar is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to renovate his shop by installing ceramic blocks on the floor and the walls. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing ceramic blocks on the floor and the walls.

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu is 36 years old. She has three children who are learning at secondary and primary school. Her husband is a builder to earn a living. He earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. Thu grows vegetables to earn a living. She has done this job for ten years. She earns about 4,000,000 per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month.

Thu has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND to grow vegetables. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy vegetable seeds.

Other members who are part of Thu's group include the following:

Do is 61 years old. She has two children. She grows vegetables. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in growing vegetables. 
Hang is 32 years old. She has one child. She sells food. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to invest in her business.
Tam is 57 years old. She has four children. She sells vegetables. She wants to borrow 6,322,000VND to invest in growing vegetables 
My is 45 years old. She has two children. She grows vegetables. She wants to borrow 10,246,000 VND to invest in growing vegetables.
My is 50 years old. She has two children. She grows vegetables. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to invest in growing vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is an Iraqi youth client. He is 19 years old and lives with his family of 5 members. Ali assists his parents in providing the family income.

Ali owns a small grocery store. He sells canned food, drinks, and dairy products. He has been practicing this business since 2009. Regardless of Ali’s age, his wide knowledge of the market gives him a good reputation.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to renovate his grocery store. Ali is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide himself a good career and a good source of living.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store.

loans.name: Rahbarzhon

texts.en: Rahbarzhon is married and has three children. Rahbarzhon is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to her children. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry 12 years ago. She cares for the cattle at her house where she has good circumstances. She has three cows and eight sheep. She requested a loan of 1500 somoni to increase the number of animals she has for sale. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.en:
Rahbar is a hardworking person who is married and has 5 children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 13 years. She has great experience in this business. Thanks to the good condition of her animals, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers.

Rahbar is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She awaits your support. She promises to make payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has two children. They live in the town of Likoni, Mombasa in their own house. They have a grocery store in their house. The store is well stocked, well known, and frequented by their neighbors and occasional customers.

The products that she offers are all of the basic needs items like sugar, rice, tea, dairy products, and other merchandise.

The requested loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of basic needs merchandise for the grocery store that she has.

loans.use: to buy more basic needs merchandise for the grocery store.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a very hardworking person with a persistent spirit and attitude. She has much experience in her field and knows what she is doing. Her goal is to one day have a large beauty salon and to be widely known for her talent. She is grateful for this opportunity, and believes that the support will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to remodel her beauty salon.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene, tiene 50 años, está casada con Roque y ellos viven solos en su de material rústico, debido a que su única hija trabaja de manera independiente en una ciudad cercana. Pese a que los trabajos del campo son muy pesados, ella no se amilana, sino por el contrario piensa en sus metas y se esmera por hacer bien las cosas, pues lleva 20 años dedicada a la agricultura ,le gusta sembrar arveja y flor de gladiolo, por los grandes beneficios económicos que le brinda ya que son muy solicitados en su región, además le encanta criar gallinas y cuyes , sin embargo le disgusta pelear con las inclemencias del tiempo que muchas veces le arrebato parte de sus cosechas y hasta la llevaron al fracaso años atrás, por suerte ahora cuenta con un asesoramiento técnico para salvar su producción.Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Irene, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, pues su meta es mejorar la calidad de sus alimentos.
texts.en: Irene is 50 years old. She is married to Roque, and they live alone in their house made of rustic materials, since their only daughter works independently in a nearby city. In spite of the fact that the farm work is very hard, she does not back down, but on the contrary, she thinks of her goals and exerts herself to do things well. She has worked in agriculture for 20 years. She likes to plant peas and gladiolus flowers for the great economic benefits that they offer her, since they are very sought after in her region. In addition, she loves to raise chickens and guinea pigs. Nevertheless, she dislikes struggling with the weather, which often takes part of her harvests and even led to failure years ago. Fortunately, she now has technical advice to save her production. This is her fifth loan with Kiva, and she feel grateful for the financial support that she receives to continue forward. Irene will invest the 2500 PEN in the purchase of organic compost to feed her plantings, since her goal is to improve the quality of their nourishment.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 31-year-old married father. He has one child and his wife is currently working as a teacher to help him earn a living. Bassam owns a small barber shop in his village, and has been working as a barber for 11 years now. He contacted Al Majmoua in order to acquire a loan that he needs for the maintenance and check up of his car. He also needs the loan in order to renovate his living room for a better environment for his family. Concerning his future plans, Bassam is planning to purchase another loan in order to help his wife open a clothing store.

loans.use: To maintain his car and renovate his living room

loans.name: Lucas Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Lucas  trabaja en una institución del estado como guarda de seguridad.
Vive en la cuidad de Managua casado está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacerle algunas mejoras a su vivienda para darle mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Lucas works as a security guard in a state institute.

He lives in the city of Managua. He is married. He is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials to make some improvements in his home to make it more comfortable for his children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is single and has two children. Even though he did not receive any formal education, Joseph is a successful businessman. He sells maize in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). He has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Joseph uses his income to provide for the entire family. Joseph will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding him in improving his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, Joseph plans to further diversify the type of products that he sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more maize

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en: Mesalimu is known as a person with a strong desire to move up in life and help her family. She is requesting the loan to establish a fish selling business, to purchase fish which she will use to have more fish in stock since demand is high, and she wants to be able to satisfy her customers. Mesalimu is grateful for the help she is receiving from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance because it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a designer and has a boutique where she sells exclusive clothing at a shopping center in Likoni, Mombasa. Rebecca has been in this line of work for more than three years. Since she has her own shop, she has many customers in the area, where she is well-known. Thanks to her business, she is able to move forward, maintain her home, and pay for any unforeseen expenses.

Rebecca is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the remodeling of her shop and purchase bales of clothes. She wants to improve the main area of her shop because providing a better look for her business will make her customers feel comfortable. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to invest in the remodeling of her shop and purchase bales of clothes.

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Kweku is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling oranges in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. Kweku is married and has five children. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Kweku wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of oranges. In the long term, Kweku plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling local dishes from her chop bar in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for one year. Adjoa is married and has two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Adjoa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of local dishes. In the long term, Adjoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of local dishes.

loans.name: Domingo Orlando

texts.es:
El señor domingo vive en la cuidad de Managua es una persona humilde muy trabajadora trabaja en un centro de compra de la capital desde hace 30 años en el área de limpieza.

 El señor domingo está solicitando a kiva  un crédito para hacer el cambio de techo de su vivienda que con la venida del invierno considera necesario para que no se le pase el agua  de lluvia a su casa.

A la vez manifiesta sentirse muy agradecido porque gracias a los créditos que ceprodel le ha otorgado ha  mejorado su casa para darle mejor condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Domingo lives in the city of Managua. He is a humble and very hard-working person. He has worked in the cleaning area of a shopping center in the capital for 30 years.

Señor Domingo is applying to Kiva for a loan to change the roof of his home, which he finds necessary with the coming of winter, so that the rainwater does not come into his house.

He also declares that he feels very grateful because thanks to the loans that CEPRODEL has offered him, he has improved his house to give better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a divorced woman and has two children who always help her out. Mwanasha has been a merchant for three years. She has a well-stocked dispensary with all of the basic goods in a well-populated area of Likoni. She says that she began with a small kiosk when she moved to town, and with a lot of sacrifice, she grew her business. There is a lot of competition in the area. She also says that she is very proud of her work because with her efforts, she has been able to support and educate her children. Mwanasha asks for a loan to buy rice, noodles, beef, drinks and other items so that she can continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, beef, drinks and other items to sell

loans.name: Jenat

texts.en: Jenat is single and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Jenat is a successful businesswoman. She sells soft drinks in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Jenat uses her income to provide for the entire family. Jenat will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Jenat plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is single and has 1 child. After successfully graduating junior high school, Juliana is now an established businesswoman. She sells fresh fish in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 2 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Juliana uses her income to provide for the entire family. Juliana will use the loan to purchase more fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Juliana plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 35-year-old single lady. She is employed in a flower shop and works 10 hours a day, every day of the week. Her income is barely enough to provide for her own expenses. Unfortunately, Nisrine contacted Al Majmoua because her mother is sick at the hospital, and needs assistance and care that she cannot afford. Thus, she needs to acquire a loan that would help her pay the hospitalization costs. 

She hopes that one day she can afford to open her own shop to make her dream come true.

loans.use: To pay for her mother's hospitalization costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Even though Esi grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Esi is an entrepreneur. She sells groundnuts and maize in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began just a few months ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. 

Esi has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more groundnuts and maize to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts and maize to sell.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat, age 41, is a married lady and a mother of five children. She has been running a business of hand embroidery for the past three years. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her locality. To meet with the increasing demand for her embroidery designs, she is including other women in her business to complete the orders of her customers on time. But due to lack of capital, she is not able to fulfill the demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) through Kashf Foundation. In this way, she will be able to buy more frames, needles, unique pearls and threads in different colors, which will help in generating more income. She is in her second loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles, unique pearls and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is married to a taxi driver. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. Gifty is currently a seamstress in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). With over two years of experience in this trade, Gifty sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus, her loan will be used to buy more cloth and other sewing materials, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. 

Gifty wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Badr

texts.en: Badr is a 51-year-old married mother of three children. She is the owner of her supermarket in her village, while her husband works in a restaurant. Their combined revenue is barely enough to provide for the entire family. She contacted Al Majmoua because it was her last hope to acquire a loan. In fact, she needs a loan to purchase aluminum windows for her house. She also wishes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum windows for her house.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Even though Efua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur. She sells fried fish in Enyaadze (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 20 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their eight children. 

Efua has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 40-year-old married woman doing a business of milk sales for the past 10 years. She has one cow in milk and two goats. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. 

She has four children. She is very motivated to provide them a healthy life with good education, food and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. Now, she applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy one more cow and some cans for milk storage. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and some cans for milk storage.

loans.name: Muglani

texts.en:
Muglani is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. Ten years ago, she started her own business of agriculture with the support of her husband.
